title: data science
desc:
In accordance with guidelines regarding companies classified as Federal contractors and consistent with our core commitment of safety National Grid has made the decision to require all new hires to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated as a condition of hire. "Full vaccination" is defined as two weeks after both doses of a two-dose vaccine or two weeks since a single-dose vaccine has been administered. Anyone unable to be vaccinated either because of a religious belief or a disability can request a reasonable accommodation. Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes communities and businesses. We are there when people need us the most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry. To be successful we must anticipate the needs of our customers reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow both ourselves and our business. National Grid is hiring a Lead Data Scientist for our Economics & Load Forecasting Department in Hicksville NY or Waltham MA. The Economics & Gas Forecasting team produces the gas load forecasts for National Grid as well economic analysis and insight. As a Lead Data Scientist you will develop present and defend the gas and load forecasts for our US service territory using econometric methods. Conduct advanced quantitative analyses and develop sophisticated statistical and machine learning models and optimization tools to help the company achieve its regulatory financial operational and growth goals. You will understand policy requirement and help ensure project development be aligned with regulatory perspective. You will support internal stakeholders including Supply Engineering Regulatory Strategy Finance and others. You will assist in the presentation and defense of the forecasts to regulatory bodies in MA RI and NY. You will ensure the forecasts incorporate new distributed energy resources technologies and policies. In accordance with guidelines regarding companies classified as Federal contractors and consistent with our core commitment of safety National Grid has made the decision to require all new hires to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated as a condition of hire. "Full vaccination" is defined as two weeks after both doses of a two-dose vaccine or two weeks since a single-dose vaccine has been administered. Anyone unable to be vaccinated either because of a religious belief or a disability can request a reasonable accommodation. This position has a career path which provides for advancement opportunities within and across bands as you develop and evolve in the position; gaining experience expertise and acquiring and applying technical skills. Internal candidates will be assessed and provided offers against the minimum qualifications of this role and their individual experience. National Grid is an equal opportunity employer that values a broad diversity of talent knowledge experience and expertise. We foster a culture of inclusion that drives employee engagement to deliver superior performance to the communities we serve. National Grid is proud to be an affirmative action employer. We encourage minorities women individuals with disabilities and protected veterans to join the National Grid team.Development of gas and electric load forecast using econometric methods. Perform additional analysis relating to the forecast as necessary. Ensure the forecasts properly account for distributed energy resources and new technologies and policies (e.g. energy efficiency demand response electrification of heat etc.). Develop advanced machine learning and statistical methods and sophisticated analytics programs for addressing and solving a wide range of problems across the business. Develop advanced quantitative analyses and optimization approaches to support senior management in solution and strategy design customer engagement marketing campaigns asset optimization and energy portfolio analysis and optimization such as hedging plans. Develop maintain and enhance gas load and customer growth forecasting by using appropriate modeling technologies and training the relevant teams on model usage and results interpretation. Translate functional policy into processes and procedures that drive greater efficiencies for National Grid and ensure compliance with regulations. Help interpret modeling and analysis results from regulatory and/or policy perspectives.
Update forecast processes and documentation to ensure they are efficient reviewable and reliable.
Provide expert testimony before regulators and defend the gas/electric forecasts. Respond to data request from regulatory bodies for rate cases and other proceedings.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders (including supply engineering regulator strategy) regarding forecast methodology and analysis and ensure our deliverables meet their needs.
Stay current in all policies regulatory requirements market trends and industry standards regarding customer energy use and technologies and programs impacting that use such as energy efficiency and demand response. Update forecast processes and documentation to ensure they are efficient reviewable and reliable. Provide expert testimony before regulators and defend the gas/electric forecasts. Respond to data request from regulatory bodies for rate cases and other proceedings. Collaborate with internal stakeholders (including supply engineering regulator strategy) regarding forecast methodology and analysis and ensure our deliverables meet their needs. Stay current in all policies regulatory requirements market trends and industry standards regarding customer energy use and technologies and programs impacting that use such as energy efficiency and demand response. Works well in a team. Bachelor’s (Master’s or PhD preferred) in statistics engineering (applied) mathematics computer science economics applied management science operations research or related field. Industrial experience is a plus. Strong hands-on experience and deep understanding of advanced quantitative analysis machine learning time series analysis process modeling and optimization. Experience in energy load forecasting preferred. Proficient in statistical programming languages such as to Python R Matlab SAS required. Experience in relational databases stored procedures SQL and Non-SQL database systems preferred. Experience in cloud computation preferred Experience in project management to meet agile project development preferred Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to testify before regulators and respond to regulatory data requests. Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Experience with policy or forecasting distributed resources (e.g. energy efficiency demand response electric vehicles PV storage electrification of heat etc.) preferred. Advanced Excel skills required. Power BI/Tableau skills preferred. Relevant energy industry experience in a regulated setting preferred. Highly motivated with the ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.

desc: Location: 1000 Nicollet Mall Minneapolis Minnesota United States 55403-2542 Lead Product Owner – Promotions Management About us: Target is an iconic brand a Fortune 50 company and one of America’s leading retailers. The Pricing & Promotions Center of Excellence (PPCoE) is a key pillar with the Merchandising organization at Target that comes to work every day on a mission to ensure our guests feel confident they paid a great price every time they shop at Target. The PPCoE Product team is focused on this vision by making it easy for our Team Members to do their jobs and create confidence that the price a Guest pays is the right price with great deals executed flawlessly throughout the Guest Experience. The Promotions Product team develops enterprise products that serve as the command center for Target team members to easily make the best decisions that bring Target’s promotional strategy to life for our guests. Our team connects the business strategies of merchandising and the creativity of marketing with the power of technology and data science to build products that will drive promotional decision making operational excellence and a seamless guest experience. Are you a creative problem-solver who loves to own a product as well as its results? Can you collaborate effectively execute a plan efficiently and positively influence how to become the easiest place to save? If so you will have success on one of our dynamic teams. About the Job: The Promotions Management Lead Product Owner is responsible for driving simplicity and efficiency in how promotions are created and managed to ensure operational excellence and a seamless guest experience. Working in partnership with our merchandising marketing stores digital and fulfillment teams you will drive automated and innovative solutions to make it easy to create share and validate all of the details required to bring promotions to life for our guests. You will build capabilities into the product to help our teams visualize the guest experience and ensure offers execute according to the strategy. The innovative solutions you build will make it simple and easy for our teams to meet our guest and business needs every day and especially on the biggest days in retail. Product Teams at Target are accountable for the delivery of business outcomes enabled through technology and analytic products that are easy to use easily maintained and highly reliable. Product teams have one shared backlog that is inclusive of all product technology discovery and design work. As a Lead Product Owner you will work in the product model and will partner to develop a comprehensive product strategy related roadmap and set key business objectives (OKRs) for your respective product. You will need to leverage the knowledge of your product as well as customer feedback and establish other relevant data points to assess value develop business cases and prioritize the direction and desired outcomes for your product. You will lead a product and work in unison with engineers UX designers data scientists and business partners to deliver a product. You will be the “voice of the product” to key stakeholders to ensure that their needs are met and that the product team is getting the direction and support that it needs to be successful. You will develop and actively understand the market maintain a product roadmap and backlog outlining the customer themes epics and stories while prioritizing the backlog to focus on the highest impact work for your team and stakeholders. "You will encourage the open exchange of information and viewpoints as well as inspire others to achieve challenging goals and high standards of performance while committing to the organizations direction. You will foster sense of urgency to achieve goals and leverage resources to overcome unexpected obstacles and partner with product teams across the organization to help them achieve their goals while pursuing and completing yours. Job duties may change at any time due to business needs." About you: 4-year college degree (or equivalent experience) 6+ years of technology product manager/owner experience; pricing/promotions experience is a plus Strong communication and stakeholder management skills Proven ability to inspire lead and influence global cross-functional teams and partners Ability to set strategic vision use test and learn to provide focus and meaningful steps to consistently deliver incremental value Strong analytic skills and data driven decision making Ability to deeply understand empathize and problem solve with a broad and diverse user base Ability to set goals measure progress courage to stop pivot or accelerate Experience with tools and change leadership to drive efficiency Experience with technology and ability to facilitate communication between business and technology teams Experience working in an agile environment (e.g. user stories iterative development scrum teams sprints personas) This position may be considered for a Full-Time Remote or Hybrid work arrangement based on Target’s needs. A Hybrid work arrangement means the team members core role will be a blend of virtual and onsite at a Target location. A Full-Time Remote work arrangement means the team member works full-time from home or an alternate location that’s not a Target location does not have a desk at their primary HQ work location and may travel to HQ up to 4 times a year. Colorado Connecticut or Nevada Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado Connecticut or Nevada residents is $97600 - $175700. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education work experience certifications etc. In addition to your salary Target cares about and invests in you as a team member so that you can take care of yourself and your family. Find competitive benefits from financial and education to well-being and beyond. Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) Target will provide reasonable accommodations (such as a qualified sign language interpreter or other personal assistance) with the application process upon your request as required to comply with applicable laws. If you have a disability and require assistance in this application process please visit your nearest Target store or Distribution Center or reach out to Guest Services at 1-800-440-0680 for additional information.4-year college degree (or equivalent experience) 6+ years of technology product manager/owner experience; pricing/promotions experience is a plus Strong communication and stakeholder management skills Proven ability to inspire lead and influence global cross-functional teams and partners Ability to set strategic vision use test and learn to provide focus and meaningful steps to consistently deliver incremental value Strong analytic skills and data driven decision making Ability to deeply understand empathize and problem solve with a broad and diverse user base Ability to set goals measure progress courage to stop pivot or accelerate Experience with tools and change leadership to drive efficiency Experience with technology and ability to facilitate communication between business and technology teams Experience working in an agile environment (e.g. user stories iterative development scrum teams sprints personas)

title: data analyst
desc: Data Analyst Role We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our digital data team to ensure that the data available as-a-service in global data warehouses meets business requirement with the right quality for enabling enterprise data and analytics and insights initiatives. Maintains the data catalog and ensure compliance of data manipulation with industry standard practices. The bulk of the work covers partnering with data engineers data scientists and product owners for data analysis and integration requirements and guiding solution design and architecture. Responsibilities Understand business data requirements and translate them into technical needs Build and maintain the data model used in global data warehouses and solutions Define the concepts and attributes of the data and manage the data dictionary of the tables Keep up to date data catalog with relevant data available and their attributes Validate quality of data and steer data quality improvement action plans Ensure and assess data quality on global data warehouses building KPIs (incident management completeness of data etc.) and setting up and automate consistency checks Identify root causes of potential malfunctions and allocate actions to the right stakeholders Partner with Product Owners and Data Engineers to prioritize the pipeline implementation plan Partner with Data Engineers and Data scientists to ensure pipelines meets business requirements Partner with data domain owner and procurement team in case of need to buy or sell data Partner with legal team regarding GDPR and other legal requirements Actively contribute to Data governance community Guide solution design to meet data and integration requirements Identify new opportunities to leverage data and to integrate data or applications to enhance business value Coordinate with data owners to ensure data accessibility and quality Tools Good knowledge of cloud computing and data storages. Knowing AWS is a plus. SQL Python Excel PowerPoint Word One or multiple of the following visualization skills : Tableau PowerBI seaborn matplolib plotly ggplot bokeh Project management & support: JIRA projects & service desk Confluence Teams Skills Expert in Data manipulation techniques (esp. querying tables with SQL Numpy) Strong capacity to develop consistent clear analysis and report potential issues Data quality audit techniques (Electronic Data Discovery) Familiarity with data science methods and scaling data science methods Soft Skills Pragmatic and capable of solving complex issues Ability to understand business needs Good communication Service-oriented flexible positive team player Self-motivated takes initiative Rigorous attention to detail to map data systems Curious to understand what is behind each data field Experience Close to 5 years of experience as Data Analyst (performed data manipulation data analysis master data management) Experience in a healthcare company is a strong plus Preferred Qualifications Master’s Degree in Mathematics Economics Computer Science Information Management or Statistics At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues patients and customers. title: data scientist
desc: Become a Part of the NIKE Inc. Team NIKE Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow think dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers leaders and visionaries. At NIKE Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game. WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR We are looking for an entrepreneurial product-minded data scientist who is passionate about working on novel applications of data science within Nikes. Examples of emerging areas include data science for digital product design interactive retail experiences and sports marketing. The goal is to lay the foundation over the next few years for leveraging data and data science at scale within these spaces. WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON In this role you will… WHO WILL YOU WORK WITH You will be a member of the Emerging Areas Data Science team. This team is part of Nike’s Consumer Data Science team and Insights function. So you will be a member of the broader data science team at Nike and participate in our data science labs study groups team activities and attend conferences. WHAT YOU BRING Open to remote work except cannot work in Colorado South Dakota Vermont and West Virginia. These candidates will be required to relocate. NIKE Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package casual work environment a diverse and inclusive culture and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location or the role every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world. NIKE Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race color religion sex national origin age sexual orientation gender identity gender expression veteran status or disability.Contribute to all stages of model development from creating proof-of-concepts and beta testing to partnering with data engineering machine learning platform and product teams to deploy algorithms evaluate the A/B test results and deliver value in alignment with roadmap and business needs. Strive to constantly improve model performance using insights from rigorous offline and online experimentation. Adhere to software engineering best practices and contribute to shared code repositories. Document modeling work and present to stakeholders and other technical and non-technical partners. Participate in the broader data science community within Nike including data science labs study groups and team activities. 3+ years of demonstrated experience developing and delivering effective machine learning and/or statistical models to serve business needs. Will accept suitable combination of education and experience. Experience developing models for production scale highly desirable. Proficiency in Python required. Excellent data wrangling skills. SQL required. Working knowledge of Spark is a plus. Expertise in recommender systems and e-commerce is highly desired. Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively cross-functionally required. Experience presenting to both technical and non-technical audiences and a history of publications or presentations at conferences is a plus. A degree in computer science statistics applied math physics or other quantitative discipline (Masters or PhD). Will accept suitable combination of education and experience

desc: Become a Part of the NIKE Inc. Team NIKE Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow think dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers leaders and visionaries. At NIKE Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game. WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR We are looking for a seasoned data science leader for our Digital Experiences Data Science team. The Senior Director of Digital Experiences role will be responsible for leading the data science teams that work on optimizing and personalizing Nike’s digital experiences. These experiences include both Nike.com and on the Nike app in the United States China Europe and elsewhere around the globe as well as Nike’s SNKRS and WeChat apps. Today this body of work is focused on using machine learning for search relevance and product recommendations. The aim is to leverage data science more broadly across these digital platforms. WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON You will… WHO WILL YOU WORK WITH You will be the leader of the Digital Experiences Data Science team reporting to the Vice President of Consumer Data Science. Digital Experiences Data Science is part of Nike’s Consumer Data Science sub-function and Insights and Analytics function. So you will be a member of the broader data science and analytics community at Nike and help organize and participate in our data science labs study groups and team activities and attend conferences. WHAT YOU BRING NIKE Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package casual work environment a diverse and inclusive culture and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location or the role every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world. NIKE Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race color religion sex national origin age sexual orientation gender identity gender expression veteran status or disability.Partner closely with the other data science leaders within Consumer Data Science. This includes aligning Digital Experience Data Science roadmaps with our those of the data science teams working in the areas of sport activity content planning and marketing communications. Reuse data and models where possible. Partner closely with Nike’s Digital Product Management leadership providing input into the overall digital roadmaps and in particular helping to identify and advocate for high leverage uses of data and data science across Nike’s digital experiences. Partner closely with Nike’s Global Technology leadership that works on data engineering platform engineering and experience engineering. Ensure that the foundational data systems and processes are in place to successfully execute on data science. Evaluate the evolving landscape of vendors of data science capabilities for ecommerce and develop a position on which capabilities should be built in house. Lead through leaders including our search and personalization data science leaders and teams that are in place today and who will report into this role. Be an inspirational thought leader within the broader analytics and data science communities at Nike. Hire onboard and mentor talented data scientists and data science leaders. Experience developing strong partnerships with engineering and product teams. Experience managing through senior managers. Experience hiring and mentoring exceptional data scientists. Experience communicating technical roadmaps to business leaders. Experience practicing data science even if not recently. A product and entrepreneurial mindset. Bachelors degree or higher or Combination of relevant education experience and training.

title: data science
desc: Are you interested in researching and providing critical data analytics that will shape the direction of a growing organization? Can you clearly communicate complex technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences? Do you have a self-starter mentality with the ability to think proactively and assimilate new concepts and information quickly. Provide the business with trusted and up to date information about our industry. Look at trends behaviors and demographics surrounding our industry clients staff franchisees markets and competitors. Find analyze organize deliver and maintain market research information and assets. Design implement and evaluate descriptive and predictive models. Lead our organizations integration of machine learning and advanced data science concepts into tools applications and processes (i.e. random forest). Use statistical analysis techniques (like survival analysis and regression modeling) to advance predictive and prescriptive organizational analysis. Contribute to projects with need or emphasis on analysis data or other business intelligence functions. Communicate effectively with both business and technical team members. Assist in analyses of data and create summaries in narrative and/or graphic displays. Assist in the collection and management of data and information so that it can be used to analyze business functions market behavior and industry trends. Investigate and analyze complex business challenges and assist in problem solving and providing solutions. Perform detailed strategic and financial analysis on various areas of operations within the organization. Act as subject matter expert and provide information and recommendations to team lead and executive team to assist in decision making. Find and present data-driven insights and conclusions to maximize bottom line results. Advocate for continual improvement towards realizing the ideal tools investment partnerships infrastructure and culture needed in the area of data-driven decision making and business intelligence to accomplish organization goals. Create maintain and evolve weekly and monthly reporting. Identify trends patterns and relationships in the data to support administrative decision making. Understand work with and assist in the upkeep and maintenance of data dictionaries. Learn and understand the nuances of corporate data metrics and source systems. Track capture and effectively communicate industry and competitor data and information. Be honest and forthright in the work you do and the interactions with Franchisees corporate employees vendors and other stakeholders you work with. Interpret and analyze policies and practices and propose new and better ways of doing things in a professional manner. Protect sensitive data ensuring all legal and ethical data standards are met. Attained an undergraduate degree with a focus in business mathematics engineering computer science finance information technology or economics. 2+ years of experience working using statistical analysis 1+ years of experience working with data science tools and skills (machine learning or AI). Worked with survey data industry studies consumer trends and demographics and writing summary reports. Strong analytical skills with the ability to understand current and future data needs. Ability to work well with teams but also as a dedicated self-starter who can ask questions and find solutions to problems as an individual.

title: data analyst
desc: Job Description: Dow Jones is looking for a data analyst to help deliver critical data-driven insights and visualizations of them for our newsrooms and product teams. This work will directly impact the direction of Dow Jones’ top publications like The Wall Street Journal MarketWatch and Barron’s. As a leader in trusted news and information Dow Jones has a large digital audience that is quickly growing. As we grow we are dedicated to understanding all of our audiences and the value we provide them. The insights discovered by this data analyst will be presented to senior editors product managers and executives and help guide strategy across content areas and multiple ongoing projects. Through this work this role will also be instrumental in the creation of new dashboards and metrics for our teams. As a member of Dow Jones’ data unit you will work closely with editors product managers engineers designers data scientists and more in a lively collaborative project to discover new offerings that bring journalistic and information services value. There is room in these roles to develop engineering program management and data science skills leading to career paths that can go in multiple directions. Requirements: Top candidates will have strengths in one or more areas of the following: Dow Jones  Making Careers Newsworthy All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race color religion sex national origin protected veteran status or disability status. EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets . Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application due to a disability please reach out to us at TalentResourceTeam@dowjones.com. Please put “Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line. Business Area: TECHNOLOGY - PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT Job Category: IT Development Group About Us Since 1882 Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world’s top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal Dow Jones Newswires Factiva Barron’s MarketWatch and Financial News. This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy depth and innovation enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence with innovative technology advanced data feeds integrated solutions expert research award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers when and where they need it every day. If you are a current employee at Dow Jones do not apply here. Please go to the Career section on your Workday homepage and view "Find Jobs - Dow Jones." Thank you. Req ID: 29872"At least 1 year of full-time working experience; or a Masters degree with related internship experience." The ability to manage organize and present data in a clear concise and actionable format Great communication skills to be able to teach editors reporters and product teams how to use tools and think about data The ability to turn raw data into visual insights to help support newsroom and product decisions. Flexible workflow and ability to manage multiple assignments in a dynamic environment Experience cleaning and manipulating messy data. Creativity and strong critical thinking skills Proficiency in SQL Excellent time management skills eagerness to learn and a desire to seek/give feedback. Ability to create clear and useful dashboards preferably with google data studio. Knowledge of Python (preferred) or R Experience with Linux and cloud-based services. Knowledge of data analytics platforms including Adobe Analytics Google Analytics Parse.ly or Chartbeat

title: data science
desc:
In accordance with guidelines regarding companies classified as Federal contractors and consistent with our core commitment of safety National Grid has made the decision to require all new hires to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated as a condition of hire. "Full vaccination" is defined as two weeks after both doses of a two-dose vaccine or two weeks since a single-dose vaccine has been administered. Anyone unable to be vaccinated either because of a religious belief or a disability can request a reasonable accommodation. Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes communities and businesses. We are there when people need us the most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry. To be successful we must anticipate the needs of our customers reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow both ourselves and our business. National Grid is hiring a Lead Data Scientist for our Economics & Load Forecasting Department in Hicksville NY or Waltham MA. The Economics & Gas Forecasting team produces the gas load forecasts for National Grid as well economic analysis and insight. As a Lead Data Scientist you will develop present and defend the gas and load forecasts for our US service territory using econometric methods. Conduct advanced quantitative analyses and develop sophisticated statistical and machine learning models and optimization tools to help the company achieve its regulatory financial operational and growth goals. You will understand policy requirement and help ensure project development be aligned with regulatory perspective. You will support internal stakeholders including Supply Engineering Regulatory Strategy Finance and others. You will assist in the presentation and defense of the forecasts to regulatory bodies in MA RI and NY. You will ensure the forecasts incorporate new distributed energy resources technologies and policies. In accordance with guidelines regarding companies classified as Federal contractors and consistent with our core commitment of safety National Grid has made the decision to require all new hires to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated as a condition of hire. "Full vaccination" is defined as two weeks after both doses of a two-dose vaccine or two weeks since a single-dose vaccine has been administered. Anyone unable to be vaccinated either because of a religious belief or a disability can request a reasonable accommodation. This position has a career path which provides for advancement opportunities within and across bands as you develop and evolve in the position; gaining experience expertise and acquiring and applying technical skills. Internal candidates will be assessed and provided offers against the minimum qualifications of this role and their individual experience. National Grid is an equal opportunity employer that values a broad diversity of talent knowledge experience and expertise. We foster a culture of inclusion that drives employee engagement to deliver superior performance to the communities we serve. National Grid is proud to be an affirmative action employer. We encourage minorities women individuals with disabilities and protected veterans to join the National Grid team.Development of gas and electric load forecast using econometric methods. Perform additional analysis relating to the forecast as necessary. Ensure the forecasts properly account for distributed energy resources and new technologies and policies (e.g. energy efficiency demand response electrification of heat etc.). Develop advanced machine learning and statistical methods and sophisticated analytics programs for addressing and solving a wide range of problems across the business. Develop advanced quantitative analyses and optimization approaches to support senior management in solution and strategy design customer engagement marketing campaigns asset optimization and energy portfolio analysis and optimization such as hedging plans. Develop maintain and enhance gas load and customer growth forecasting by using appropriate modeling technologies and training the relevant teams on model usage and results interpretation. Translate functional policy into processes and procedures that drive greater efficiencies for National Grid and ensure compliance with regulations. Help interpret modeling and analysis results from regulatory and/or policy perspectives.
Update forecast processes and documentation to ensure they are efficient reviewable and reliable.
Provide expert testimony before regulators and defend the gas/electric forecasts. Respond to data request from regulatory bodies for rate cases and other proceedings.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders (including supply engineering regulator strategy) regarding forecast methodology and analysis and ensure our deliverables meet their needs.
Stay current in all policies regulatory requirements market trends and industry standards regarding customer energy use and technologies and programs impacting that use such as energy efficiency and demand response. Update forecast processes and documentation to ensure they are efficient reviewable and reliable. Provide expert testimony before regulators and defend the gas/electric forecasts. Respond to data request from regulatory bodies for rate cases and other proceedings. Collaborate with internal stakeholders (including supply engineering regulator strategy) regarding forecast methodology and analysis and ensure our deliverables meet their needs. Stay current in all policies regulatory requirements market trends and industry standards regarding customer energy use and technologies and programs impacting that use such as energy efficiency and demand response. Works well in a team. Bachelor’s (Master’s or PhD preferred) in statistics engineering (applied) mathematics computer science economics applied management science operations research or related field. Industrial experience is a plus. Strong hands-on experience and deep understanding of advanced quantitative analysis machine learning time series analysis process modeling and optimization. Experience in energy load forecasting preferred. Proficient in statistical programming languages such as to Python R Matlab SAS required. Experience in relational databases stored procedures SQL and Non-SQL database systems preferred. Experience in cloud computation preferred Experience in project management to meet agile project development preferred Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to testify before regulators and respond to regulatory data requests. Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Experience with policy or forecasting distributed resources (e.g. energy efficiency demand response electric vehicles PV storage electrification of heat etc.) preferred. Advanced Excel skills required. Power BI/Tableau skills preferred. Relevant energy industry experience in a regulated setting preferred. Highly motivated with the ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.

desc: Us: The professional home and leading national organization for health services researchers policymakers and health care practitioners and stakeholders. AcademyHealth – together with its members – increases the understanding of methods and data used in the field enhances the professional skills of researchers and research users and advocates for the use of evidence to improve health and health care for all. In 2020 we established three strategic priorities: science innovation; diversity equity and inclusion and health systems improvement resilience and capacity. You: An early career professional with 3-5 years of experience who is highly organized a great writer comfortable reviewing and understanding metrics and eager to take on new challenges. Familiarity with health care issues and policy is beneficial but not required. The ideal candidate asks questions like “what do we know about our members and their needs; what information do we need to make better decisions about engaging them; and what can we learn from the ways people interact with us now?” You do not need to match every listed expectation to apply for this position. We believe that diverse perspectives foster the innovation we need to be successful and we are committed to building a team that encompasses a variety of backgrounds experiences and skills. How you’ll contribute:\nThe Associate Marketing & Analytics will spend half their time on marketing campaigns and half their time on data analytics. The position will work with internal data to provide insights and identify opportunities to increase engagement with AcademyHealth through membership conferences and other virtual and in-person events. Our goal is to transform our data collection management and synthesis strategy to increase member recruitment engagement and retention as well as more effectively market our many conference and program offerings. The position compiles maintains and learns from membership and marketing data supports marketing efforts for several AcademyHealth programs and initiatives and helps create and deploy effective marketing content engages the diverse audiences that our organization serves. Desired Qualifications: What you should know: Applications:\nQualified applicants should send a cover letter resume writing sample and three references (with emails) to Human Resources. Please be sure to reference the position for which you are applying. For more information please go to www.academyhealth.org. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $55000.00 - $63000.00 per year Benefits: Schedule: Experience: Work Location: RemoteLead the marketing efforts for AcademyHealth scholarships fellowships awards orientations and webinars. Build and maintain reports and dashboards; use data and analytics to draw insights and translate into actionable change. Work with IT and the Marketing Manager to increase our use of automation and lead generation. Assist with the promotion of AcademyHealth’s suite of conferences. Write and edit marketing materials including website email collateral and social media content. Research and build new and diverse audience and marketing contact lists. Collaborate closely with IT and membership teams to understand our various audiences their diverse needs and purchasing and engagement patterns. Ensure data integrity and list management for the marketing and communications team. Understands basic principles of data-driven marketing and the connection between data analytics and marketing strategy. Excellent analytical and numerical skills creativity with great problem-solving skills. Ability to interpret a variety of data from various sources including websites social media surveys search engines and paid media; along with an aptitude to clearly articulate findings. Demonstrates excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. Thinks proactively and takes initiative. Loves being part of a dynamic collaborative team. Communicates well in person and in writing creates compelling copy and loves a good marketing visual. Knows how to wrest productivity and knowledge from technology – familiar with common database analytics and collaboration software. Bachelor’s degree in marketing communications or data science preferred or equivalent combination of education training and experience. AcademyHealth is a hybrid work environment with options for remote and in office work. We require all employees to be fully vaccinated to work in the office unless entitled to an accommodation. Applicants outside the metropolitan DC area are encouraged to apply. We will be conducting our hiring process virtually and conducting interviews via phone or video. We will provide candidates selected for interviews with all the required instructions. A limited amount of travel to meetings is expected. We offer a collegial work environment countless professional development opportunities and a competitive compensation and benefits package. 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Employee assistance program Flexible schedule Flexible spending account Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Professional development assistance Retirement plan Tuition reimbursement Vision insurance 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Marketing: 4 years (Preferred)

title: data engineer
desc: Please do not apply through Indeed. The only way you will be considered is if you follow the link at the bottom of the page and take a very short quiz. Who are we? Raybeam Inc. is a software engineering consulting company focused on strategic consulting data science and data management solutions. We have offices in Newburyport MA Mountain View CA and Austin TX. We’ve supported a strong list of clients for over twenty years including Google Facebook Microsoft eBay One Kings Lane Disney and Hilton Worldwide. What do we do? We provide technology solutions to data problems by architecting and developing enterprise systems using a variety of programming languages tools and platforms. We might build a data warehouse for a client a pipeline management system a web application or an analytical system integrated with a business process. We work in small teams own the projects we work on and have direct input into the business decisions of our clients. What are we looking for? We seek a flexible well-rounded software engineer with an interest in translating business goals into concrete solutions. We’d like someone confident of their 4-10 years of experience with software development. You’ve been part of more than one team you’ve demonstrated initiative on most of your projects and you can tell us in technical detail what you did to help. Ideally you’ve worked with at least one devops team and in at least one flavor of agile. If you haven’t we won’t hold that against you and people with fewer years and lots of relevant experience can also be good candidates. What we’d like to see in you: Experience or proficiency in several of the following is expected: What do you get from working for Raybeam? We have fantastic benefits including competitive pay fully paid health insurance (including vision) free daily lunch 401k contribution long term disability insurance flexible schedule annual company outing generous vacation/sick time holidays and more! If you are interested in applying for the position please click on the link below to take a short quiz. https://careers.raybeam.com/ *Please note that Raybeam Inc. is currently unable to provide sponsorship and we will only consider local candidates. Job Type: Full-time Benefits: Schedule: Supplemental Pay: COVID-19 considerations:\nDue to COVID all employees are currently working remotely. When it is safe to do so we will return to the office. Education: Experience: Work Location: One locationBreadth of knowledge: You have a solid foundation in software engineering concepts and experience in a diverse range of specific technologies. Excellent communication skills: You can explain what you are doing and why to your teammates and clients. Adaptability: You can work with new technologies in changing situations. Problem Solving: You can solve problems under pressure. Pipeline management tools like Airflow or Luigi and/or enterprise ETL tools like Informatica SSIS or Datastage Devops tools like Terraform Kubernetes Docker Scripting languages like Python Ruby Compiled languages like Java Scala C++ Database Management Systems like BigQuery Snowflake PostgreSQL mySQL Oracle MS SQL Server Redshift Experience working in cloud environments (AWS or GCP) is preferred. Experience with Unix-based OSes a plus! The opportunity to work for a variety of Fortune 500 companies. Excellent resume builder due to the exposure to a variety of technologies and experiences. The chance to have input into business decisions of our clients. A fun supportive work environment that promotes camaraderie and growth. The chance to travel and network with important figures in the industry. The opportunity to learn technologies that you’ve always wanted but never had the chance. 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Flexible schedule Flexible spending account Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Parental leave Referral program Retirement plan Vision insurance 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Bonus pay "Bachelors (Preferred)" data engineering: 2 years (Preferred)

title: data engineer
desc: Position Description About us Mack is part of the Volvo Group one of the world’s leading manufacturers of trucks buses construction equipment and marine and industrial engines under the leading brands Volvo Renault Trucks Mack Eicher SDLG Terex Trucks Prevost Nova Bus and Volvo Penta. Auto req ID Organization State / Province City/Town Employment/Assignment Type Travel Required (maximum) Functional Area Last application date US Disclaimer textServe as an expert in the AI/ML and Data Science areas. Maintain the production methods and standards for data analysis and visualization. Active participation in Global networks and escalate plant needs to the AI/ML network for support. Assist business units with actionable data and help in achieving business goals. Develop and plan competence development for AI/ML algorithms and big data analytics. Troubleshoot and maintain software and infrastructure needed to gather report and visualize data. Promote data literacy and awareness drive cost reduction and intelligent decision-making using data analytics. Develop cost saving proposals using the data engineering techniques. Improve productivity and efficiency of data pipelines. Development of future data engineering solutions geared towards the lowest possible cost and with flexibility for product and volume changes in mind. Develop and maintain AI/ML roadmap and new technology integration plan. Maintain anchor and forecast capital and expense connected to AI/ML and Data Science software. Be the manufacturing and IT point of contact within Technology Organization regarding AI/ML and Data Science competence area. Benchmark external companies and research agencies to ensure we are up to date with the external consensus on relevant global process and technology trends. Understanding of the complete data chain from storing structuring and modeling to visualizing and translating data into actionable insights. Programming experience and efficiency in Python R C/C++ Java or similar languages pertaining to AI/ML model development Experience developing and applying machine learning methods such as: Classification regression clustering generative modeling etc. Experience in schema design and data modelling including SQL skills to analyze and explore data Experience with cloud computing/ web services or related areas. Preferably experience with Microsoft Azure. Demonstrated experience applying Agile and lean methodologies and familiarity with other project management methodologies such as ISIP PSM etc. Familiarity with truck manufacturing concepts including operational logistics and manufacturing flows to support production systems and increase efficiencies. Multitasking and ability to work with various problems coming from different areas of the assembly process. Flexible and motivated mindset with a willingness to learn fast and upskill in new areas Proven ability to visualize future opportunities plan action items towards successful completion of company objectives. Problem Solving/Decision Making: Taking a well-ordered approach to solving problems and acting despite obstacles resistance or ambiguity. Communication and interpersonal skills and a demonstrated ability to manage change. Proven ability to react to issues impacting production with a sense of urgency promptly assessing the issue and developing a feasible action plan and following it through to successful completion. Experience in a team-based environment. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Excellent skills in the Microsoft suite. "Bachelors degree in Data Science Computer Science Information Technology Mathematics or related field." 2-3 years manufacturing experience or equivalent with a focus on engineering data science or AI/ML. Relevant experience in Data Analytics Predictive AI/ML algorithms

desc:
Looking for a Data-focused test engineer:
With experience in Data Catalog Data Quality Data Governance Master Data Management and/or Data Stewardship technologies and processes
To work as part of an agile product team delivering tested changes aligned with each sprint to support development lifecycles
With the potential to evolve more predictive and intelligent testing approaches based on automation and innovative testing products & solutions
To be a proactive self-motivated and independent contributor with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment and deliver high-quality work on tight schedules With experience in Data Catalog Data Quality Data Governance Master Data Management and/or Data Stewardship technologies and processes To work as part of an agile product team delivering tested changes aligned with each sprint to support development lifecycles With the potential to evolve more predictive and intelligent testing approaches based on automation and innovative testing products & solutions To be a proactive self-motivated and independent contributor with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment and deliver high-quality work on tight schedules Position responsibilities include:
Partner with Data Engineers stewards and others to gather and define business requirements understand technical designs and systems and to support the development lifecycle of the product team
Develop and drive risk-based testing strategies that may span multiple product teams systems and dependencies
Understanding ETL logic in order to write complex SQL queries for data quality validation
Identify and analyze data discrepancies and data quality issues; work to ensure data consistency and integrity
Capture testing artifacts and provide reports based on meeting test deliverables
Ensure all defect artifacts are documented triaged and resolved in a timely manner
Coach and mentor others on testing practices and tools Partner with Data Engineers stewards and others to gather and define business requirements understand technical designs and systems and to support the development lifecycle of the product team Develop and drive risk-based testing strategies that may span multiple product teams systems and dependencies Understanding ETL logic in order to write complex SQL queries for data quality validation Identify and analyze data discrepancies and data quality issues; work to ensure data consistency and integrity Capture testing artifacts and provide reports based on meeting test deliverables Ensure all defect artifacts are documented triaged and resolved in a timely manner Coach and mentor others on testing practices and tools 2-4 years of Python or Java scripting experience Previous experience as a DBA and/or a strong understanding of DB structures Ability to query databases using SQL to investigate discrepancies in data using comparative analysis techniques Experience working with APIs and in analyzing JSON and/or XML outputs Experience using tools such as ASG Informatica and/or Alation Strong knowledge of data structures algorithms enterprise systems and asynchronous architectures Enterprise understanding in test planning test data management automated & manual test execution and test management tools to support a complex data landscape Proven experience in defining and executing testing strategies by partnering with business and development teams to understand project scope risk and data workflows. Must have experience with CI/CD pipelines in-sprint test automation and CI integration One plus years of agile experience using SCRUM or Kanban Understanding of QA methodologies life cycle and processes Strong knowledge and extensive experience with unit functional and performance testing is desired Bachelor or higher-level degree in MIS Data Analytics Data Science Computer Science or Computer Engineering preferred Financial Services background desired FORTUNE 2020 – Edward Jones was named No. 7 on the 2020 FORTUNE 100 Best Companies to Work For® list.

desc: Span of Influence:Define data needs and evaluate data quality for applicability to posed problems Use statistical modeling machine learning and numerical optimization to discover and leverage patterns in data using: Time Series Analysis Classification Algorithms Clustering Regressions Recommender Systems Linear/Nonlinear Optimization Monte-Carlo simulation text mining natural language processing Create features and develop models beyond standard toolset libraries to meet unique business challenges. Interpret and communicate findings and insights from the data to business partners Transform re-engineer and extract data in relational and MPP (Hadoop) data bases using appropriate tools including SQL PLSQL Hive Impala Spark and PIG. Build out data sets that meet data requirements. Analysis that facilitates the transformation of complex data/information into actionable insights. Includes advanced financial analysis forecasting data modeling statistical analysis and complex financial modeling. Develop divisional and Firm-level measurements to influence strategic direction. BA Required with an emphasis in a business discipline such as accounting finance economics data science engineering analytics (or relevant work experience). Masters Preferred 5 years relevant work experience Advanced analysis skills forecasting and complex modeling. Ability to understand and identify opportunities to apply the different types of statistics and advanced analytical concepts. Ability to summarize complex financial and analytical information and concepts and clearly communicate up to executive management. Advanced ability to effectively work with relational and dimensional database architectures Prior use of a Hadoop environment preferred Strong analytical critical and systems thinking required Technical proficiency preferred in the following: Decisions made based on analysis and recommendations provided through this role generally have a moderate to high risk on Firm performance Decisions of moderate complexity and moderate impact (e.g. sourcing pricing strategy development analytical model development etc.) are made independently; more complex and high-impact decisions generally made in consultation with leader The Analyst develops and performs high complexity financial analysis with typically high financial impact. The Analyst works with leaders up to executive management providing analytical guidance to directly influence strategic business decisions. While there are no direct supervisory responsibilities mentoring and training other associates on the team as well as associates on project teams from other divisions is expected. To successfully influence decision making this position requires a deep understanding of how departments/divisions interact with one another and impact firm operations and initiatives. title: data engineer
desc: Data Engineer As a Data Engineer you will be working in a department that plays a crucial role in supporting the success of the business. They department is responsible for developing and implementing state-of-the-art software and reporting dashboards and APIs to support our distribution and operational areas with secure stable and resilient technology platforms. Location: Overland park - KS ZIP code: 66223 Reference: 109903 Secondary Reference: #DICE#LI-SH1INDITTOAW#ITZRAre you passionate about solving complex business problem using data science and machine learning? Does the prospect of solving high impact business problems excite you? Are you looking for an company that offers great benefits and equity stake? Are you looking for a remote role? If so we what to talk to you! Build efficient repeatable data pipelines both to both serve and monitor models Building data products incrementally and integrating and managing datasets from multiple sources Development of data APIs and data delivery services to support critical operational processes and analytical models Identify the bottlenecks of data flow and analysis architect and implement solutions such as automation of data processing pipelines optimization of data queries and enhancement of data visualization and interpretation Create interactive reports and dashboards with stunning visualizations Write complex SQL queries interacting with databases using PostgreSQL MySQL and MongoDB "Bachelors degree or equivalent experience in quantitative field - Computer Science Statistics Mathematics. title: data science
desc: About Macy’s is proudly America’s Department Store. For more than 160 years Macy’s has served generations at every stage of their lives. Customers come to us for fashion value and celebration. Now is an exciting time to join Macy’s Inc. The face of retail is changing and change requires innovation. "Macys Inc is building an Enterprise Data & Analytics team to further grow our capabilities in support of our mission to be a data - led customer centric company. This team will focus on accelerating impact from analytics coordinating an enterprise-wide roadmap and ensuring proper data governance and management. As a leader on this team the VP Enterprise Data Science will help lead the charge to execute on our vision to build profitable lifetime customer relationships by embedding data & analytics at the heart of everything we do." Job Overview The VP Enterprise Data Science is responsible for setting and owning the enterprise strategy of data science and machine learning building best-in-class data science teams modernizing data science and machine learning technology and platform leading data science chapter across Macy’s Inc. to effectively execute on priority use cases. The VP will drive analytics and algorithm integration and development for use cases and establish norms standards and a data-driven culture throughout the organization. The VP will lead and build a team of Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers who will set the standard across the organization and partner closely with business units to support execution and productionizing solutions. The VP will report to the SVP of Enterprise Data & Analytics who leads Enterprise Data & Analytics to accelerate digital transformation and value delivery from data and analytics and coordinate efforts across the enterprise. Essential Functions Data Science and Machine Learning: Culture: Leadership: Key Performance Indicators: Qualifications and Competencies Competencies Communication: What we can offer you: Physical RequirementsSet enterprise roadmap and deploy best-in-class advanced analytics and ensure scalability and reusability of codebase and models while establishing standardized enterprise methodologies. Define and enforce data science and machine learning standards including guidelines for tailoring analytics methodologies to specific use case needs (e.g. ML AI descriptive analytics). Lead data science chapter across all business and technology teams and align data science strategies to business priorities. Advance machine learning capabilities at Macy’s Inc to empower business decisions with speed and scale through streamline production and automation. Partner with business stakeholders to optimize the design of end-to-end data science & machine learning solutions to drive user adoption change management and accelerate analytics value delivery Institute quality control and ethical guidelines for algorithms code and outputs. Drive innovation technical excellency and work with product management and engineering to identify and implement data tools to ensure efficient and seamless execution of analytics. Create and foster community of practice for data science and machine learning. Be entrepreneurial agile and results oriented. Drive innovation and change management to create an understanding of potential applications of advanced analytics and data science. Increase agility in identifying data issues and taking action to remediate. Encourage user adoption of analytical tools and methods and embrace data in strategic business decisions. Create awareness knowledge and conviction around data-driven practices and behaviors increasing digital IQ of organization. Strategic leader with a passion for data science and machine learning who can build a team with capability to drive business impact. Lead the enterprise agenda for data science and machine learning and drive alignment with senior leadership team. Partner closely with Technology and Business Units to drive adoption as well as provide direct analytical support where needed. Balance both leading a team and engaging directly with the work needed to accomplish the priority use cases. Lead talent strategy across data science chapter. Create and foster career development and growth paths for team members in alignment with company and personal objectives. Provide guidance on recruitment and career pathing for data science chapter. Promote Macy’s data science and machine learning teams and work with external data science community. Coach direct reports as they build strategies and roadmaps. Assist direct reports with ongoing prioritization and resource allocation to ensure that the crucial business initiatives are delivered. Demonstrate Macy’s leadership commitments of promoting diversity and inclusion encouraging growth creating connection and driving performance. Integration development and deployment of algorithms and methodologies for analytics use cases. Adoption of coding and methodology best practices across the enterprise. Additional metrics dependent upon prioritized use cases supported (e.g. lift customer acquisition retention etc.). Annualized value to business vs. expense Masters or PhD in statistics operations research decision science machine learning or related discipline. Data scientist with over 15+ years of experience in the field. 10+ years of leading & managing a large team of data scientists focused on enterprise solutions. Experience in retail or consumer industry is strongly preferred Demonstrated track record of developing articulating and driving a strategy of where and how data science and machine learning can create value and improve business performance with proven results. Data science expert with experience in delivering data science initiatives accelerating analytics-driven outcomes and transforming data into business value in the retail/consumer context. Fluent in complex algorithms and analytics methodologies across multiple platforms and languages. Analytics expert with experience in delivering robust analytics use cases across business units with experience in cross-functional collaboration. Community builder who can foster a data and analytics culture and support data-driven thinking and discussions. Customer-centric and experienced with successful cross-functional collaboration. Ability to effectively share technical information communicate technical issues and solutions to all levels of business Able to juggle multiple projects - can identify primary and secondary objectives prioritize time and communicate timeline to team members Ability and desire to take product/project ownership Ability to work a flexible schedule based on department and Company needs Strong executive presence with ability to communicate complex messages and trade-offs and tell a compelling story; Demonstrable presentation written verbal and interpersonal communication skills. Ability to influence a diverse group of stakeholders Strong problem solver with ability to lead the team to push the solution and progress Strong leadership skills – ability to lead people and teams including giving strength-based feedback OKR based individual development Hands-on coaching to help the team solve complex problems. "Exciting challenging problems to solve across Macy’s Inc. - youll never have a boring day at the office." A refreshingly fun work environment where you will collaborate with a smart and talented team. Unique freedom to build and lead a team in next gen thinking. A chance to learn and participate in the growth of one of the nation’s premier omnichannel retailers. Requires prolonged periods of sitting with occasional standing Occasionally requires walking bending reaching hearing and talking Continuous use of computers and other office equipment Frequently lift/move up to 10 lbs

title: data scientist
desc: Job Summary: The role will perform research and development of advanced analytics solutions in healthcare. Interact with subject matter experts to uncover important insights and build on concepts in statistics optimization and machine learning to improve patient and provider experiences. Identify strategic issues forms hypothesis design and conduct analyses synthesize conclusions into recommendations and presentation materials and conducts follow-up studies. Position Responsibilities: Use mathematics statistics predictive models business analysis and cloud technology to transform high volumes of complex data into advanced analytic solutions. Understand and document business/clinical needs as well as recommend appropriate IS solutions to deliver the needed data. Serve as primary data liaison to the business/clinical areas to ensure overall expectations are met or exceeded for all data/reporting needs. Facilitate effective customer engagement through regular applicable governance meetings rounding and communications regarding requirements enhancements and priorities. Keep abreast of current healthcare trends by attending appropriate meetings and reviewing current literature. Provides market intelligence on a regular basis to operations/product line managers and executives. Research on how to collect or find raw data that can be transformed into meaningful information. Position Qualifications Required: Required Experience: 2+ years’ experience applying modern machine learning algorithms (clustering classification and regression) statistical methods and optimization. Strong skills in SQL fluency in coding in R and/or Python. Experience using major cloud platforms such as AWS and/or Azure. Strong data visualization abilities in Tableau/Qlikview ggplot etc. Familiarity with EPIC is preferred. Required Education: Master’s Degree in Data science analytics mathematics business or related field. Training / Certification / Licensure: Advanced level experience with SQL NOSQL Tableau Azure R and/or Python and other database tools for research and analysis.

desc:
In accordance with guidelines regarding companies classified as Federal contractors and consistent with our core commitment of safety National Grid has made the decision to require all new hires to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated as a condition of hire. "Full vaccination" is defined as two weeks after both doses of a two-dose vaccine or two weeks since a single-dose vaccine has been administered. Anyone unable to be vaccinated either because of a religious belief or a disability can request a reasonable accommodation. Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes communities and businesses. We are there when people need us the most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry. To be successful we must anticipate the needs of our customers reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow both ourselves and our business. National Grid is hiring a Lead Data Scientist for our Data Science department in Waltham MA National Grid seeks a Lead Data Scientist who is passionate about the role advanced analytics can play in providing their community with heat and power - safely affordably and cleanly. At National Grid you will collaborate with a team of data scientists data engineers and MLOps specialists to solve problems across all parts of the business (gas electric and customer). You will work in a dynamic organization to turn data into actionable intelligence. The variety and complexity of challenges you will solve is second to none but most important is the real world impact your work will have on the lives of millions of people. As a member of the National Grid Data Science team you will work cross-functionally mining big and small data and applying a variety of analytics techniques (from simple to advanced) to solve business challenges. Example projects the team has worked on include storm-caused electric outage predictions ML-based gas leak detection and EV charger installation forecasting. Success in this role requires a strong foundation in: This position has a career path which provides for promotional opportunities within and across bands as you develop and evolve in the position; gaining experience expertise and acquiring and applying technical skills. Internal candidates will be assessed and provided offers against the minimum qualifications of this role and their individual experience. National Grid is an equal opportunity employer that values a broad diversity of talent knowledge experience and expertise. We foster a culture of inclusion that drives employee engagement to deliver superior performance to the communities we serve. National Grid is proud to be an affirmative action employer. We encourage minorities women individuals with disabilities and protected veterans to join the National Grid team.Stakeholder engagement Data Science/Machine Learning Statistical & Probabilistic Analyses Programming/Software Development Effective Visualization and Presentation Lead major projects from conception to completion working with multiple teams of stakeholders directly to understand and address their analytic needs Collaborate with Data Engineering to identify extract and integrate data sets ranging in size from spreadsheets to big data; prepare and clean data for use in advanced analyses Employ sophisticated analytics machine learning and statistical methods for predictive and prescriptive modeling forecasting and simulations Develop structured documented version-controlled code and work with ML Ops to productionalize models Mentor junior Data Scientists Contribute toward the strategic vision for shaping the Data Science team of tomorrow Works well in a team. Energy industry interest Bachelors degree or higher plus 7+ years of experience as a data scientist (or similar) in a business environment. Candidates with an MS and/or PhD require less experience. Experience leading projects Demonstrated ability to communicate and interact with business stakeholders Demonstrated ability to translate technical knowledge into business terms Fluency in:
Machine learning tools and techniques
Python
SQL Machine learning tools and techniques Python SQL Be intellectually curious and enjoy learning Work well in a team environment

So you will also be a member of the broader data science and analytics community at Nike and participate in our data science labs study groups and activities and attend conferences. What you bring NIKE Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package casual work environment a diverse and inclusive culture and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location or the role every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world. Lead workstreams that require cross-functional squads that include data scientists data engineers analysts and product managers. Manage our portfolio of member model capabilities including lifetime value segmentation fraud and onboarding models. Develop methods and tools that further enrich Nike’s member data while also respecting the privacy of our members. Expand the vision for member modeling at Nike. Learn the business of designing shoes and apparel and bringing them to market around the globe to understand how to best serve stakeholders. Be a part of the broader data science community within Nike and contribute to a culture of learning. Experience hiring and mentoring exceptional data scientists. Experience leading through leaders (directors will report into you). Experience developing strong partnerships with engineering and product teams. Experience communicating technical roadmaps to business leaders. Experience practicing data science. A product and entrepreneurial mindset.
