Happy Health is a stealth mode mental health startup led by Sean Rad (founder and former CEO of Tinder). We’ve raised $50M in venture financing to build radical new solutions for brain and body health. Our technology is based on decades of research in biomedical engineering computational psychiatry and wellness theory to build the first ever truly brain-focused wearable. With millions of hours of annotated trial data collected with academic and industry partners we are building one of the largest multi-sensor health-related datasets ever. The Clinical Research Team at Happy is composed of friendly practical team-oriented people with broad backgrounds and diverse skill sets. We work closely with the Machine Learning and Data Sciences team to design and test protocols and collect data for a wide array of human subjects and survey-based research studies that support the development of sensor-level algorithms and product features. We spend a lot of time discussing different approaches to data collection to meet goals and we value input from all team members. At Happy you’ll not only make a difference quickly having a direct effect on our success you will also be able to grow your career path and expand your research skills. What you will be doing: Your Background: Job Type: Full-time Pay: $60000.00 - $80000.00 per year Benefits: Schedule: Ability to commute/relocate: Education: Experience: Work Location: One locationContribute to the design of research protocols in collaboration with the Product and Machine Learning and Data Science teams Develop and maintain research study documents (e.g. protocols informed consent documents participant instructions) Manage company device/sensor inventory and support device-related testing and quality assurance efforts Support human subjects research data collection efforts including the extraction and upload of sensor data. Research studies may include lab-based research activities field-based research activities and survey-based research Lead preliminary data analysis efforts to maintain a tight feedback loop between data collection and data science activities Support research participant management efforts such as participant recruitment participant onboarding/training and informed consent Manage ongoing publication needs through literature reviews data analysis preparation of scientific articles Travel as needed to support in-person research efforts in various US-based locations Build strong collaborative relationships with internal and external stakeholders BS/BA in Life Science or related degree Master-level degree preferred (e.g. MS MPH) 3+ years of human subjects research experience Experience with use of early-stage investigational devices preferably with the ability to troubleshoot biomedical devices and consumer wearables Knowledge of the research study lifecycle with the ability to understand concepts of human subjects research and study design Thorough understanding of good clinical practices and human subjects research ethics and compliance Experience collecting and managing large survey-based and/or sensor-based datasets Strong Microsoft Office suite and Google Suite skills Strong data analytic skills preferably with experience in biomedical field Highly analytical strong problem-solving skills detail oriented Effective verbal and written communication skills Ability to work proactively and independently Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously Ability to collaborate effectively with internal stakeholders and build strong relationships with external stakeholders Ability to travel up to 20% of the time 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Monday to Friday Austin TX 78758: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) "Bachelors (Required)" human subjects research: 3 years (Preferred)

title: data scientist
desc: PhD in a quantitative field (Computer Science Math Statistics etc.) 6+ years of experience in business intelligence and analytics Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Power Point Proficient in a modern scripting language (preferably Python) Proficient running queries against data (preferably with Google BigQuery or SQL) Proficient with data visualization software (preferably Tableau) Mastery utilizing statistical techniques to identify key insights that help solve business problems Proficient in Prescriptive Modeling like optimization computer vision recommendation search or NLP Attracts Top Talent: Attracting and selecting the best talent to meet current and future business needs "Business Insight: Applying knowledge of the business and the marketplace to advance the organizations goals" Collaborates: Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives Communicates Effectively: Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences Cultivates Innovation: Creating new and better ways for the organization to be successful Customer Focus: Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions "Develops Talent: Developing people to meet both their career goals and the organizations goals" Directs Work: Provides direction delegating and removing obstacles to get work done Drives Results: Consistently achieving results even under tough circumstances Nimble Learning: Actively learning through experimentation when tackling new problems using both successes and failures as learning fodder Optimizes Work Processes: Knowing the most efficient and effective processes to get things done with a focus on continuous improvement Self-Development: Actively seeking new ways to grow and be challenged using both formal and informal development channels

title: data engineer
desc: Additional Roles & ResponsibilitiesApply strong technical and management skills to guide data engineering teams in building industry-leading technology Build data products data platforms and analytical tools to increase productivity of Data Analysts Data Scientists and Marketers Driving product vision and strategy and creating capabilities that marketing data science teams can leverage when building solutions for audience based marketing and data monetization etc. Embrace an active team role to design build and launch efficient and reliable data pipelines moving data across a number of platforms including Data Warehouse online caches and real-time systems. Create data architecture that is flexible scalable and consistent for cross-functional use and aligned to stakeholder business requirements. Manage workflow orchestration and demonstrate expertise in data modeling ETL development and data warehousing Design industry-leading tools to increase productivity of Data Analysts Data Scientists and Marketers Partner with BI IT Marketers and Data Scientists to understand data needs and assist them in accessing and leveraging key data sets Define SLA and acceptable time lags by data source define QA process and socialize resolution process to ensure data is flowing accurately through data creation to our presentation layers Help Marketing organization to become a 100% data-driven organization by building a next generation data platform that brings accurate and timely data to the Marketers Validate Data Engineering business data elements organizational and business intelligence architecture designs for engineering functional areas from Dashboards Data Lakes Data Operations ML - AI and upstream/downstream intake and output processes Designs and builds the data strategies and roadmaps necessary to serve marketing analytics and data science needs BA/BS Degree in Computer Science any Engineering discipline Statistics Information Systems or another quantitative field. 6+ years of industry experience in data engineering data science or related field with a track record of manipulating processing and extracting value from large datasets Experience leading a Data Engineering Team Experience building and managing data pipelines and repositories in cloud environments such as Google Cloud Microsoft Azure or AWS Experience in Airflow is a must Advanced experience extracting/cleansing data and generating insights from large transactional data sets using Spark SQL SQL Python and PySpark on cloud Experience in Apache Spark Spark Structured Streaming Spark SQL etc. Experience with optimizing Spark pipelines on Dataproc Databricks or similar technologies. Strong verbal and written communications skills at all levels; ability to communicate complex customer behavior information to both functional partners and Executive Leadership Open to idea exploration with strong problem-solving/analytical abilities Demonstrated strength in creating partnerships and in building relationships with other functions and associates within the organization Experience leading and presenting proof of values and business to leaders

"At Wellspring our mission is to redefine care for the most vulnerable children. The healthcare system is failing special needs children especially those from underserved homes. Its a struggle to find care to afford care and to receive the quality of care that they deserve.

We are a company currently in stealth mode that is transforming home health for special needs children from low-income families through purpose-built thoughtful technology and a unique care model with parents at the core." Wellspring is well-funded by world-class investors and phenomenal digital health leaders of this decade. We’re led by a founder who grew up on Medicaid (public insurance) and personally knows the desperation of not being able to afford medically-necessary care. Here we believe that anything can be achieved through pure will determination and grit. We’re looking for operators with a similar mindset to join the team. How we’re bringing care into the 21st century with technology: We’re looking for passionate ambitious and empathetic hustlers to join us as generalist operators and leaders. You’ll work closely with the founding team create unparalleled processes to bring care to families and scale a company function for growth.

In this role you will: Our Value Prop to You We index more on your experience and hustle than a college degree from a shiny institution. This role would be a fit for you if you have the following: "If youre passionate and excited about delivering life-changing care to families in need working with a tight-knit team of builders accelerating your career and growth and making an impact on the next category-defining company don’t hesitate to apply.

Even if you are hesitant after reading this entire job description just apply anyway. One small action can always change an entire trajectory."Clinical and operational excellence. Our culture emphasizes clinical quality. What powers clinical excellence is operational excellence. That’s why we invest heavily in building and growing talented teams of operators and leaders. Value and outcome-driven care. We strive to deliver the best-in-class care to our families. We use data science to help our children meet their milestones tailor personalized care plans and provide preventative care. Parent coaching and support. We believe that parents are key to children’s wellbeing and health. Our care model incorporates family support and we build app interfaces to connect clinicians and parents. Digital health integrations. We leverage telehealth to give superpowers to our clinical teams. We build internal tools to decrease clinical burnout and improve the measurement of health outcomes. Own and run a company pillar end-to-end. You’ll define strategy for expansion set northstar KPIs build scalable processes and drive mission-crucial initiatives. Craft foundational operations processes. You’ll help take our operations team to new heights through improving processes and constructing growth playbooks. Grow an all-star operations team. As you define processes you’ll grow your team to maximize the surface area for execution. You’re excited to lead a performing team with strong values and empathy. "Partner with technology clinical and product teams across Wellspring. Youll be a critical voice for collaboration among initiatives to further our mission." Highly-competitive compensation with sign-on bonus company equity and benefits. Everyone on the Wellspring team receives company equity and salaries above industry standards. Our builders are a critical part of our team and we strive to reflect this through ownership and pay. Environment for growth and learning. You will have the opportunity to drive great impact and gain exposure to all functions of the company. At Wellspring you can flex multiple realms of your operating skillset strategic mindset and creativity. Propel innovation in healthcare. We are leading the change in home health against traditional providers with outdated systems. You’ll be able to operate in a fast-paced environment to deliver care and iterate. "An energizing compassionate team. Our team cares deeply about each other. We strive to elevate and uplift each other in our day-to-day work to do the best for our families. We dont believe in bureaucratic nonsense." Supporting your wellbeing. We provide benefits to allow you to do your best work:
Competitive medical vision dental 401K and life insurance.
Remote and in-person hybrid work options. You pick what suits you.
Stipend to upgrade your work-from-home setup. Is it time for a new mechanical keyboard?
Unlimited paid-time-off (PTO) and parental leave. We want you to rest as hard as you work.
Paid company off-sites meetups and team bonding events. You’ll get to see everyone outside of their Zoom box. Competitive medical vision dental 401K and life insurance. Previous entrepreneurial experience as a founder

Experience in business analytics and performance measurement (or willing to learn). You’ve used a myriad of tools spanning from spreadsheets to ads optimization dashboards. You have done something most people haven’t. From ex-Juilliard musicians to international-ranked champions anyone with an untraditional background is welcome. Empathy an entrepreneurial spirit intellectual horsepower and unbounded curiosity. Pride in being the jack-of-all trades.
Everyone has heard of the ‘a jack of all trades is a master of none’ quote. However what most people missed is the second half of the quote ‘a jack of all trades is a master of none but oftentimes better than a master of one’. You know this and it’s your superpower.

Every day we are solving critical business objectives by mining data performing ad hoc analyses recommending product analyzing profitability building dashboards
and interacting with every part of our business. We need a hardworking individual who can help us move to the next level in all aspects of the data science realm including programming
quantitative expertise and business expertise.
Responsibilities:
This individual contributor role will support process improvement using coding/automation. The successful candidate will be well versed in Database structures
query building in Microsoft Access/SQL. The person in this role will help link our analytics with short and long-term business strategy to effectively drive profitable sales.
The Data Analyst/Developer will apply statistical analyses and coding to business problems spanning across various functional areas including product development
merchandising and operations. The role requires collaboration with cross-functional partners to yield key business insights and support decision-making.
In addition to having technical capabilities the ideal candidate is also a curious diligent and self-motivated problem solver with the ability to manage opposing priorities.
Qualifications and education requirements: Preferred qualifications: Job Types: Full-time Contract Pay: $45.00 - $48.00 per hour Benefits: Schedule: Experience: Work Location: RemoteExperience with SQL Experience with Visual Basic Python and/or R Statistical techniques such as regression hypothesis testing multivariate analysis Experience with machine learning Strong coding skills and knowledge in data structure & algorithms Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Detail oriented comfortable digging into code and working with imperfect data sets Excellent communication skills and a “can do” demeanor is a must Degree focus in statistics math science engineering or another quantitative field Proven application of advanced techniques in a business setting with impactful results Retail analytics experience Experience with Tableau or PowerBI Experience with at least one of the following: RPA Blue Prism Cognos Dental insurance Health insurance 8 hour shift Monday to Friday SQL: 1 year (Preferred) Python or R: 1 year (Preferred)

desc: Looking for a career in which you can make an impact? Join the award-winning IQVIA eCOA team on its journey to disrupt the healthcare industry and improve patients’ clinical research experience. Who we’re looking for: You will be part of a small and growing team of developers located across the US focused on building new and modern software that’s positioned to revolution the clinical trial space. In this remote role you’ll be empowered and encouraged to think “outside the box” to develop innovative solutions to drive business and the industry forward. You believe that pushing yourself out of your comfort zone is the only way to grow. You love the idea of owning a product from developing new mobile app features to scaling to meet market demands. Not only are you fluent with React Native but you’re experienced with JavaScript/TypeScript. Position overview: We’re seeing immense growth in the industry and our core focus is scaling our native application’s feature set to meet that growth. Bring your talent and drive to our team of passionate creative and innovative thinkers focused on developing a sophisticated product that uses modern JavaScript. We have the support and resources of a large company but operate with a start-up culture. You’ll thrive in a fast-paced and agile environment during which you see real-time results. As we work to rapidly expand our team you’ll have the opportunity to grow your career in the direction that’s right for you. RESPONSIBILITIES: SKILLS: IQVIA eCOA "Patients will always be the ultimate customer in healthcare but they need to be heard. Our goal is to help ensure that each patient is at the center of care and give them a voice to share their story. IQVIA’s eCOA (electronic clinical outcomes assessment) Division has developed an award-winning platform that intelligently automates capturing patients experiences through real-time direct-from-patient data collection. This enables the client real-time access to the patient’s experience which in-turn improves the treatment and eventual outcome." At IQVIA we believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. The advanced analytics technology solutions and contract research services we provide to the life sciences industry are made possible by our 70000+ employees around the world who apply their insight curiosity and intellectual courage every step of the way. Learn more at jobs.iqvia.com. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race color religion sex sexual orientation gender identity national origin disability status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law. IQVIA Inc. provides reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities. Applicants who require reasonable accommodation to submit an application for employment or otherwise participate in the application process should contact IQVIA’s Talent Acquisition team at workday_recruiting@iqvia.com to arrange for such an accommodation.Serve as critical development resource on cross platform mobile application Work collaboratively and efficiently across functional teams in a fast-paced startup-like environment. High standard of engineering quality through source control code reviews continuous integration and unit tests. Extend our platform to handle an expanding set of features. Improve infrastructure and application development Review and refactor legacy code Provide input on the establishment of development best practices and standards for the organization 3+ years experience as a software engineer Experience with React (React/Redux/React Native) Software development experience: JavaScript/TypeScript Experience with SQL databases (SQLite/Postgres) Experience with Swift Objective-C Java and Kotlin are a plus Experience with mobile application deployments (Android/iOS) Experience with data/event streams (Amazon Kinesis/Apache Pulsar) Familiarity with a CI/CD tool (CircleCI/AWS CodePipeline) Experience with cloud platforms (AWS)

The company looks for people who can grow think dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers leaders and visionaries. At NIKE Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game. Member Modeling Data Science is part of Nike’s Insights function. So you will also be a member of the broader data science and analytics community at Nike and participate in our data science labs study groups and activities and attend conferences. What you bring NIKE Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package casual work environment a diverse and inclusive culture and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location or the role every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world. Hire onboard and develop additional data scientists and data science directors. Lead workstreams that require cross-functional squads that include data scientists data engineers analysts and product managers. Manage our portfolio of member model capabilities including lifetime value segmentation fraud and onboarding models. Develop methods and tools that further enrich Nike’s member data while also respecting the privacy of our members. Expand the vision for member modeling at Nike. Learn the business of designing shoes and apparel and bringing them to market around the globe to understand how to best serve stakeholders. Be a part of the broader data science community within Nike and contribute to a culture of learning. Experience hiring and mentoring exceptional data scientists. Experience leading through leaders (directors will report into you). Experience developing strong partnerships with engineering and product teams. Experience communicating technical roadmaps to business leaders. Experience practicing data science. A product and entrepreneurial mindset. Bachelors degree or higher or Combination of relevant education experience and training.

desc:
Become a Part of the NIKE Inc. Team NIKE Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow think dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers leaders and visionaries. At NIKE Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game. Nike’s Commercial Analytics team provides descriptive predictive and prescriptive solutions to drive business decisions that ensure consumers have access to the products they want when and where they want them. That’s no easy task! Come help Nike continue to develop our data science team. WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

At Nike we are always on the offense and we are looking for an analytics expert who has a robust business acumen and a proven track record of creating measurable impact. The Director Data Science will manage a team of data scientists to develop and implement new capabilities to enable data-driven and consumer-led decisions for Nike’s commercially oriented functions with a focus on supporting demand planning and supply/inventory planning decisions. Strong candidates are comfortable learning quickly and thrive in an entrepreneurial environment – i.e. they are curious self-starters flexible problem solvers outstanding communicators and disciples of progress over perfection! A team-player attitude is essential since we value a culture that is collaborative intellectually curious and diverse. WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON

As the Director Data Science you will: WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH

You will be on the leadership team of Global Commercial Analytics Data Science team. You will collaborate closely with your peers in analytics business partners product management and technology. Core partners include Demand and Supply Management (demand planning supply and inventory planning) and Supply Chain. Open to remote work except cannot work in South Dakota Vermont and West Virginia. These candidates will be required to relocate. For employees based in Colorado this position starts at $157500.00 per year. Information about benefits can be found here. NIKE Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package casual work environment a diverse and inclusive culture and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location or the role every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world. NIKE Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race color religion sex national origin age sexual orientation gender identity gender expression veteran status or disability.Partner with peer data science leaders to set department’s strategy to enable the design of scalable end-to-end analytics solutions and identify and build new opportunities for cross-squad collaboration increased code sharing across teams and enhanced scalability of solutions across multiple partner groups. Drive strategy around implementing new data science methodologies and selection of new tools. Partner with analytics product managers to anticipate identify and facilitate the solution to enterprise issues concerning critical business needs and support product road-mapping and prioritization decisions across the analytics portfolio. Partner with engineering teams to influence enterprise-level data products IT architecture and engineering platform strategies to meet the needs of business and the data science solutions. Help shape Nike’s central data science platform by identifying foundational data science capabilities and creating scalable reusable and customizable analytical components. Work with key business partners to understand and anticipate current and future business needs. Evangelize data science and help senior leadership identify business areas where data science will make the biggest impact. Evangelize the value of analytic products through effective storytelling and collaboration with key partners. Keep abreast of technology trends as well as emerging data science tools techniques and standard methodologies. Recruit manage mentor and inspire data science team(s); managing performance goals and development potential. Cultivate professional development opportunities. Help team members establish development goals set goals with business priorities develop for the future and evaluate success. Create and foster an environment that values and promotes diversity and inclusion autonomy skill mastery empowerment transparency innovation and continuous learning Open to remote work except cannot work in CO SD VT and WV. Candidates will be required to relocate. 8 years of hands-on engineering experience developing BI systems and working with big data "Bachelors degree in Mathematics Statistics or related field" A strong problem solving and analytical approach. Excels at critical thinking Able to influence and communicate effectively both verbally and written with team members business partners and leadership Demonstrated ability to identify and resolve both people and process related issues Able to influence critical business outcomes in a matrix based global environment Expert understanding of solution and technical design Excellent communication skills and experience in conveying complex information in easy-to-understand language. Experience in building successful data science teams. Experience leading multiple teams and the development of complex solutions Understand the ecosystem of diverse skills that need to come together to make a large-scale data science project successful. Extensive and/or in-depth knowledge of data science machine learning and optimization modeling and algorithms. Demonstrated understanding of market demand and supply interactions. Familiarity with common data sets related to products consumers market performance and supply chain. Demonstrated experience in leading technical projects at enterprise scale and managing a team through all stages of Data Science/Analytics lifecycle. Strong familiarity with modern software practices technologies and programming languages such as Python SQL Git. Strong familiarity with the Agile development process and proven ability to prepare a project plan communicate the plan to the team and break the work down to trackable tasks. Proven track record of effectively influencing and collaborating with multi-functional partners to identify new opportunities solve complex business problems and build impactful analytics solutions. Deep knowledge and experience with a diversity of tools and platforms (Prefer experience w/ Python Spark AWS or other cloud environments). Able to quickly pick up new programming languages technologies and frameworks

title: data science
desc:
By clicking the “Apply” button I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge. Takeda is a global values-based R&D-driven top 10 biopharmaceutical leader committed to discover and deliver life-transforming treatments guided by our commitment to patients our people and the planet. Our Data Sciences Institute (DSI) is made up of more than 250 quantitative scientists who harness the insight of data and digital to speed the development of highly innovative
treatments to patients. These scientists (from statistics programming outcomes research and epidemiology quantitative clinical pharmacology digital strategy library sciences and data architecture/governance) bring their expertise to our global program teams and re-imagine our disciplines. They work with novel data streams including real-world data and digital tools and apply advanced analytics including artificial intelligence and automation. As part of DSI the Statistics and Quantitative Sciences (SQS) at Takeda is looking to add individuals to our team that are team oriented collaborative strong understanding of the
statistical programming function exceptional leaders and innovators. SQS aspires to bring safe and effective medications to the patients with our quantitative skills. We design efficient trials contribute to clinical development strategies perform high quality statistical analyses and pursue operational excellence. The objectives and overall purpose of this role include: Advance the consistent use of innovative statistical and data science methods across all stages of R&D and across all SQS TAUs/BUs and functions. Collaborate with and drive virtual team members embedded within the SQS TAUs/BUs and functions to build and deliver SQS institutional knowledge. Provide technical leadership and guidance for selected projects by consulting on clinical development and regulatory strategy. Establish strong network and collaborations with internal and external statistical experts to bring new ideas to increase drug development efficiency. Enhance Takeda’s reputation in the Statistical Quantitative and Data Sciences internal to Takeda and across the broader health care community. Delivery & Business Accountabilities Organize and drive the overall SQS strategy to develop institutional knowledge across SQS TAUs/BUs and functions to maximize the use of consistent and innovative statistical and data science methods. Promote statistical and data science methodological and software development that is driven by project needs. Coordinate multiple SQS Research Hubs of team members embedded within SQS TAUs/BUs and functions to drive innovative methods development through research documentation and education. Provide strategic vision for long-term delivery innovation. Provide statistical leadership and support to selected programs by consulting on study design endpoints analysis interpretation statistical regulatory strategy regulatory
responses and regulatory interactions. Establish strong network and collaborations with internal and external statistical experts to support development activities and bring new ideas to increase drug development
efficiency. Actively participate in external professional initiatives and organizations to identify industry best practice and its applicability in Takeda. Enhance Takeda’s reputation in statistical societies and broaden networks with regulatory academic and pharmaceutical industry statisticians. CORE ELEMENTS RELATED TO THIS ROLE Experience representing Statistics function in interactions with regulatory agencies. Advanced knowledge of clinical study designs analysis methodology and data interpretation. Advanced knowledge of pharmaceutical industry overall drug development process with expertise in the cross-functional interfaces with the Statistics function. Advanced knowledge of FDA and ICH regulations and industry standards applicable to the design analysis of clinical trials and regulatory submissions. Excellent oral and written communications skills. Specialized statistical expertise in multiple therapeutic areas and development phases. Strong interpersonal and people management skills. Strong project management skills. Strong collaborative skills and ability to work with a cross-functional team. Ability to influence inspire and motivate others without direct hierarchical authority and affect change across organizational boundaries. Technical/Functional (Line) Expertise Technical expertise across multiple TAUs with ability to drive optimized methodology in drug R&D. Leadership in functional methodology decision making to optimize the likelihood of drug R&D success across multiple TAUs/BUs. Capability to create technical strategic vision and implements long-term innovation that is aligned with global regulatory and payer policies and trends. Capability to create major technical and methodology projects and guides them to implementation across R&D. The ability to establish external network to facilitate collaborations across industry government and academia. title: data science
desc: Data is at the center of everything we do. As a startup we disrupted the credit card industry by individually personalizing every credit card offer using statistical modeling and the relational database cutting edge technology in 1988! Fast-forward a few years and this little innovation and our passion for data has skyrocketed us to a Fortune 200 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making. As a Data Scientist at Capital One you’ll be part of a team that’s leading the next wave of disruption at a whole new scale using the latest in computing and machine learning technologies and operating across billions of customer records to unlock the big opportunities that help everyday people save money time and agony in their financial lives. Role Description\nIn this role you will: The Ideal Candidate is: Basic Qualifications: Preferred Qualifications: Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position and you require an accommodation please contact Capital One Recruiting at 1-800-304-9102 or via email at RecruitingAccommodation@capitalone.com. All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations. "For technical support or questions about Capital Ones recruiting process please send an email to Careers@capitalone.com" Capital One does not provide endorse nor guarantee and is not liable for third-party products services educational tools or other information available through this site. Capital One Financial is made up of several different entities. Please note that any position posted in Canada is for Capital One Canada any position posted in the United Kingdom is for Capital One Europe and any position posted in the Philippines is for Capital One Philippines Service Corp. (COPSSC).Partner with a cross-functional team of data scientists software engineers and product managers to deliver a product customers love Leverage a broad stack of technologies — Python Conda AWS H2O Spark and more — to reveal the insights hidden within huge volumes of numeric and textual data Build machine learning models through all phases of development from design through training evaluation validation and implementation Flex your interpersonal skills to translate the complexity of your work into tangible business goals Innovative. You continually research and evaluate emerging technologies. You stay current on published state-of-the-art methods technologies and applications and seek out opportunities to apply them Creative. You thrive on bringing definition to big undefined problems. You love asking questions and pushing hard to find answers. You’re not afraid to share a new idea A leader. You challenge conventional thinking and work with stakeholders to identify and improve the status quo. You’re passionate about talent development for your own team and beyond Technical. You’re comfortable with open-source languages and are passionate about developing further. You have hands-on experience developing data science solutions using open-source tools and cloud computing platforms. Bachelor’s Degree plus 6 years of experience in data analytics or Master’s Degree plus 4 years of experience in data analytics or PhD plus 1 year of experience in data analytics At least 2 years’ experience in open source programming languages for large scale data analysis At least 2 years’ experience with machine learning At least 2 years’ experience with relational databases PhD in “STEM” field (Science Technology Engineering or Mathematics) plus 3 years of experience in data analytics At least 1 year of experience working with AWS At least 4 years’ experience in Python Scala or R for large scale data analysis At least 4 years’ experience with machine learning At least 4 years’ experience with SQL

The company looks for people who can grow think dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers leaders and visionaries. At NIKE Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game. Member Modeling Data Science is part of Nike’s Insights function. So you will also be a member of the broader data science and analytics community at Nike and participate in our data science labs study groups and activities and attend conferences. What you bring NIKE Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package casual work environment a diverse and inclusive culture and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location or the role every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world. NIKE Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Hire onboard and develop additional data scientists and data science directors. Lead workstreams that require cross-functional squads that include data scientists data engineers analysts and product managers. Manage our portfolio of member model capabilities including lifetime value segmentation fraud and onboarding models. Develop methods and tools that further enrich Nike’s member data while also respecting the privacy of our members. Expand the vision for member modeling at Nike. Learn the business of designing shoes and apparel and bringing them to market around the globe to understand how to best serve stakeholders. Be a part of the broader data science community within Nike and contribute to a culture of learning. Experience hiring and mentoring exceptional data scientists. Experience leading through leaders (directors will report into you). Experience developing strong partnerships with engineering and product teams. Experience communicating technical roadmaps to business leaders. Experience practicing data science. A product and entrepreneurial mindset. Bachelors degree or higher or Combination of relevant education experience and training.

title: data science
desc:
Become a Part of the NIKE Inc. Team NIKE Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow think dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers leaders and visionaries. At NIKE Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game. Nike’s Commercial Analytics team provides descriptive predictive and prescriptive solutions to drive business decisions that ensure consumers have access to the products they want when and where they want them. That’s no easy task! Come help Nike continue to develop our data science team. WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

At Nike we are always on the offense and we are looking for an analytics expert who has a robust business acumen and a proven track record of creating measurable impact. The Director Data Science will manage a team of data scientists to develop and implement new capabilities to enable data-driven and consumer-led decisions for Nike’s commercially oriented functions with a focus on supporting demand planning and supply/inventory planning decisions. Strong candidates are comfortable learning quickly and thrive in an entrepreneurial environment – i.e. they are curious self-starters flexible problem solvers outstanding communicators and disciples of progress over perfection! A team-player attitude is essential since we value a culture that is collaborative intellectually curious and diverse. WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON

As the Director Data Science you will: WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH

You will be on the leadership team of Global Commercial Analytics Data Science team. You will collaborate closely with your peers in analytics business partners product management and technology. Core partners include Demand and Supply Management (demand planning supply and inventory planning) and Supply Chain. Open to remote work except cannot work in South Dakota Vermont and West Virginia. These candidates will be required to relocate. For employees based in Colorado this position starts at $157500.00 per year. Information about benefits can be found here. NIKE Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package casual work environment a diverse and inclusive culture and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location or the role every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world. NIKE Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race color religion sex national origin age sexual orientation gender identity gender expression veteran status or disability.Partner with peer data science leaders to set department’s strategy to enable the design of scalable end-to-end analytics solutions and identify and build new opportunities for cross-squad collaboration increased code sharing across teams and enhanced scalability of solutions across multiple partner groups. Drive strategy around implementing new data science methodologies and selection of new tools. Partner with analytics product managers to anticipate identify and facilitate the solution to enterprise issues concerning critical business needs and support product road-mapping and prioritization decisions across the analytics portfolio. Partner with engineering teams to influence enterprise-level data products IT architecture and engineering platform strategies to meet the needs of business and the data science solutions. Help shape Nike’s central data science platform by identifying foundational data science capabilities and creating scalable reusable and customizable analytical components. Work with key business partners to understand and anticipate current and future business needs. Evangelize data science and help senior leadership identify business areas where data science will make the biggest impact. Evangelize the value of analytic products through effective storytelling and collaboration with key partners. Keep abreast of technology trends as well as emerging data science tools techniques and standard methodologies. Recruit manage mentor and inspire data science team(s); managing performance goals and development potential. Cultivate professional development opportunities. Help team members establish development goals set goals with business priorities develop for the future and evaluate success. Create and foster an environment that values and promotes diversity and inclusion autonomy skill mastery empowerment transparency innovation and continuous learning Open to remote work except cannot work in CO SD VT and WV. Candidates will be required to relocate. 8 years of hands-on engineering experience developing BI systems and working with big data "Bachelors degree in Mathematics Statistics or related field" A strong problem solving and analytical approach. Excels at critical thinking Able to influence and communicate effectively both verbally and written with team members business partners and leadership Demonstrated ability to identify and resolve both people and process related issues Able to influence critical business outcomes in a matrix based global environment Expert understanding of solution and technical design Excellent communication skills and experience in conveying complex information in easy-to-understand language. Experience in building successful data science teams. Experience leading multiple teams and the development of complex solutions Understand the ecosystem of diverse skills that need to come together to make a large-scale data science project successful. Extensive and/or in-depth knowledge of data science machine learning and optimization modeling and algorithms. Demonstrated understanding of market demand and supply interactions. Familiarity with common data sets related to products consumers market performance and supply chain. Demonstrated experience in leading technical projects at enterprise scale and managing a team through all stages of Data Science/Analytics lifecycle. Strong familiarity with modern software practices technologies and programming languages such as Python SQL Git. Strong familiarity with the Agile development process and proven ability to prepare a project plan communicate the plan to the team and break the work down to trackable tasks. Proven track record of effectively influencing and collaborating with multi-functional partners to identify new opportunities solve complex business problems and build impactful analytics solutions. Deep knowledge and experience with a diversity of tools and platforms (Prefer experience w/ Python Spark AWS or other cloud environments). Able to quickly pick up new programming languages technologies and frameworks

title: data architect
desc: As senior member of the Digital Data team the head of data architecture will play a hands-on leadership role to lead develop and enhance the data architecture team. He or She will be responsible for the overall data architecture coherence and state of the art data platforms. Digital Data architecture team is in charge of setting the enterprise standards reviewing and/or implementing solutions and services transversally in collaboration with the different data verticals (Data engineering Data Dev Ops visual engineering Data Domain functions). This leader will ensure internal and external solutions are consistent to the overall strategies across Sanofi relevant roadmaps and internal standards where appropriate. The position will report directly to the Global Head of Data architecture Operations and Governance. This role will closely work with multiple transversal Digital teams (e.g. Data Agile CoE Consumer Experience Architecture committees) Digital Technology (e.g. infrastructure cloud network cybersecurity) and key business stakeholders. Efforts will also include developing and reviewing business cases and identifying potential technologies that could support business capabilities and their digital transformations. This resource will have direct people management responsibilities and accountability for several teams: Data Architects – technical solution architects supporting the Digital Data priorities within business & analytic Real-World evidence R&D industrial affairs ... Portfolio and Project Planning – Work closely with the program team and be in charge of defining priorities resources and budgets. This resource will also drive continuous improvements within their scope inclusive of documentation processes governance success measurement criteria and operating models. KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS: Have solid experience in developing Data architecture roadmaps blueprints and designing real world solutions. Experience with both Waterfall and Agile methodologies. Possess practical knowledge of data solutions in business processes and business decisions. Pharmaceutical and life science experience is a nice to have. Demonstrate excellent skills of translating requirements into workable fit for purpose technical designs and solutions. Have extensive experience on technical solution identification and rationalization. Previous Hands-on experience in delivering and leading Data Science and machine learning projects Proven experience in all phases of a Big Data/Analytics project: Concept & design development implementation change and operation Advanced experience in programming (Python SQL bash) Experience with Docker Kubernetes/AKS/EKS/Openshift Experience with DevOps CI/CD and MLOps automation Experience in cloud architecting and machine learning technologies – Azure/AWS/GCP Experience in data technologies Snowflake and other data warehouses informatica Kafka AWS data toolbox Airflow databricks . Experience in designing data and/or machine learning solution architectures Strong customer focus assertiveness and precise method of operation Ability in understanding of architectural dependencies of technologies in a vast and complex environment Able to communicate and present internally and externally in a confident manner Proven ability to build develop and lead teams Must be able to quickly adapt to a changing and highly dynamic work environment Strong relationship management skills in working with business colleagues Digital team members senior leadership team members and vendors Demonstrated ability to lead and/or influence decision making Resolve conflicts with tact and diplomacy Ability to communicate clearly and effectively. Fluent in English both orally and in writing. Other language skills are a plus Ability to work autonomously and work effectively with global teams to get the job done BACKGROUND: "Bachelors degree in Computer Science Engineering or related scientific or technical disciplines. Advanced degree is preferred. Additional professional certificate is a plus" >10+ years Data ML Ops experience is a plus. Strong demonstrated experience in leadership Implementation and Operational Support senior stakeholder management business partnering and clear effective communication skills. Experience leading multidisciplinary teams with direct supervisory and people management responsibilities. desc:
By clicking the “Apply” button I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge. Takeda is a global values-based R&D-driven top 10 biopharmaceutical leader committed to discover and deliver life-transforming treatments guided by our commitment to patients our people and the planet. Our Data Sciences Institute (DSI) is made up of more than 250 quantitative scientists who harness the insight of data and digital to speed the development of highly innovative
treatments to patients. These scientists (from statistics programming outcomes research and epidemiology quantitative clinical pharmacology digital strategy library sciences and data architecture/governance) bring their expertise to our global program teams and re-imagine our disciplines. They work with novel data streams including real-world data and digital tools and apply advanced analytics including artificial intelligence and automation. As part of DSI the Statistics and Quantitative Sciences (SQS) at Takeda is looking to add individuals to our team that are team oriented collaborative strong understanding of the
statistical programming function exceptional leaders and innovators. SQS aspires to bring safe and effective medications to the patients with our quantitative skills. We design efficient trials contribute to clinical development strategies perform high quality statistical analyses and pursue operational excellence. The objectives and overall purpose of this role include: Advance the consistent use of innovative statistical and data science methods across all stages of R&D and across all SQS TAUs/BUs and functions. Collaborate with and drive virtual team members embedded within the SQS TAUs/BUs and functions to build and deliver SQS institutional knowledge. Provide technical leadership and guidance for selected projects by consulting on clinical development and regulatory strategy. Establish strong network and collaborations with internal and external statistical experts to bring new ideas to increase drug development efficiency. Enhance Takeda’s reputation in the Statistical Quantitative and Data Sciences internal to Takeda and across the broader health care community. Delivery & Business Accountabilities Organize and drive the overall SQS strategy to develop institutional knowledge across SQS TAUs/BUs and functions to maximize the use of consistent and innovative statistical and data science methods. Promote statistical and data science methodological and software development that is driven by project needs. Coordinate multiple SQS Research Hubs of team members embedded within SQS TAUs/BUs and functions to drive innovative methods development through research documentation and education. Provide strategic vision for long-term delivery innovation. responses and regulatory interactions. Establish strong network and collaborations with internal and external statistical experts to support development activities and bring new ideas to increase drug development
efficiency. Actively participate in external professional initiatives and organizations to identify industry best practice and its applicability in Takeda. Enhance Takeda’s reputation in statistical societies and broaden networks with regulatory academic and pharmaceutical industry statisticians. CORE ELEMENTS RELATED TO THIS ROLE Experience representing Statistics function in interactions with regulatory agencies. Advanced knowledge of clinical study designs analysis methodology and data interpretation. Advanced knowledge of pharmaceutical industry overall drug development process with expertise in the cross-functional interfaces with the Statistics function. Advanced knowledge of FDA and ICH regulations and industry standards applicable to the design analysis of clinical trials and regulatory submissions. Excellent oral and written communications skills. Specialized statistical expertise in multiple therapeutic areas and development phases. Strong interpersonal and people management skills. Strong project management skills. Strong collaborative skills and ability to work with a cross-functional team. Ability to influence inspire and motivate others without direct hierarchical authority and affect change across organizational boundaries. Technical/Functional (Line) Expertise Technical expertise across multiple TAUs with ability to drive optimized methodology in drug R&D. Leadership in functional methodology decision making to optimize the likelihood of drug R&D success across multiple TAUs/BUs. Capability to create technical strategic vision and implements long-term innovation that is aligned with global regulatory and payer policies and trends. Capability to create major technical and methodology projects and guides them to implementation across R&D. The ability to establish external network to facilitate collaborations across industry government and academia. title: data science
desc:
In accordance with guidelines regarding companies classified as Federal contractors and consistent with our core commitment of safety National Grid has made the decision to require all new hires to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated as a condition of hire. "Full vaccination" is defined as two weeks after both doses of a two-dose vaccine or two weeks since a single-dose vaccine has been administered. Anyone unable to be vaccinated either because of a religious belief or a disability can request a reasonable accommodation. Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes communities and businesses. We are there when people need us the most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry. To be successful we must anticipate the needs of our customers reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow both ourselves and our business. National Grid is hiring a Lead Data Scientist for our Economics & Load Forecasting Department in Hicksville NY or Waltham MA. The Economics & Gas Forecasting team produces the gas load forecasts for National Grid as well economic analysis and insight. As a Lead Data Scientist you will develop present and defend the gas and load forecasts for our US service territory using econometric methods. Conduct advanced quantitative analyses and develop sophisticated statistical and machine learning models and optimization tools to help the company achieve its regulatory financial operational and growth goals. You will understand policy requirement and help ensure project development be aligned with regulatory perspective. You will support internal stakeholders including Supply Engineering Regulatory Strategy Finance and others. You will assist in the presentation and defense of the forecasts to regulatory bodies in MA RI and NY. You will ensure the forecasts incorporate new distributed energy resources technologies and policies. In accordance with guidelines regarding companies classified as Federal contractors and consistent with our core commitment of safety National Grid has made the decision to require all new hires to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated as a condition of hire. "Full vaccination" is defined as two weeks after both doses of a two-dose vaccine or two weeks since a single-dose vaccine has been administered. Anyone unable to be vaccinated either because of a religious belief or a disability can request a reasonable accommodation. This position has a career path which provides for advancement opportunities within and across bands as you develop and evolve in the position; gaining experience expertise and acquiring and applying technical skills. Internal candidates will be assessed and provided offers against the minimum qualifications of this role and their individual experience. National Grid is an equal opportunity employer that values a broad diversity of talent knowledge experience and expertise. We foster a culture of inclusion that drives employee engagement to deliver superior performance to the communities we serve. National Grid is proud to be an affirmative action employer. We encourage minorities women individuals with disabilities and protected veterans to join the National Grid team.Development of gas and electric load forecast using econometric methods. Perform additional analysis relating to the forecast as necessary. Ensure the forecasts properly account for distributed energy resources and new technologies and policies (e.g. energy efficiency demand response electrification of heat etc.). Develop advanced machine learning and statistical methods and sophisticated analytics programs for addressing and solving a wide range of problems across the business. Develop advanced quantitative analyses and optimization approaches to support senior management in solution and strategy design customer engagement marketing campaigns asset optimization and energy portfolio analysis and optimization such as hedging plans. Develop maintain and enhance gas load and customer growth forecasting by using appropriate modeling technologies and training the relevant teams on model usage and results interpretation. Translate functional policy into processes and procedures that drive greater efficiencies for National Grid and ensure compliance with regulations. Help interpret modeling and analysis results from regulatory and/or policy perspectives.
Update forecast processes and documentation to ensure they are efficient reviewable and reliable.
Provide expert testimony before regulators and defend the gas/electric forecasts. Respond to data request from regulatory bodies for rate cases and other proceedings.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders (including supply engineering regulator strategy) regarding forecast methodology and analysis and ensure our deliverables meet their needs.
Stay current in all policies regulatory requirements market trends and industry standards regarding customer energy use and technologies and programs impacting that use such as energy efficiency and demand response. Update forecast processes and documentation to ensure they are efficient reviewable and reliable. Provide expert testimony before regulators and defend the gas/electric forecasts. Respond to data request from regulatory bodies for rate cases and other proceedings. Collaborate with internal stakeholders (including supply engineering regulator strategy) regarding forecast methodology and analysis and ensure our deliverables meet their needs. Stay current in all policies regulatory requirements market trends and industry standards regarding customer energy use and technologies and programs impacting that use such as energy efficiency and demand response. Works well in a team. Bachelor’s (Master’s or PhD preferred) in statistics engineering (applied) mathematics computer science economics applied management science operations research or related field. Industrial experience is a plus. Strong hands-on experience and deep understanding of advanced quantitative analysis machine learning time series analysis process modeling and optimization. Experience in energy load forecasting preferred. Proficient in statistical programming languages such as to Python R Matlab SAS required. Experience in relational databases stored procedures SQL and Non-SQL database systems preferred. Experience in cloud computation preferred Experience in project management to meet agile project development preferred Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to testify before regulators and respond to regulatory data requests. Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Experience with policy or forecasting distributed resources (e.g. energy efficiency demand response electric vehicles PV storage electrification of heat etc.) preferred. Advanced Excel skills required. Power BI/Tableau skills preferred. Relevant energy industry experience in a regulated setting preferred. Highly motivated with the ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.

cons: Depending on what team you are on you can either have a great work life balance or a very poor work life balance. (in 14 reviews) Full of people with hidden agendas and/or ulterior motives. (in 19 reviews) Management also seems to feel the need to a restructuring at least every two years. (in 12 reviews)
title: data science
desc:
In accordance with guidelines regarding companies classified as Federal contractors and consistent with our core commitment of safety National Grid has made the decision to require all new hires to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated as a condition of hire. "Full vaccination" is defined as two weeks after both doses of a two-dose vaccine or two weeks since a single-dose vaccine has been administered. Anyone unable to be vaccinated either because of a religious belief or a disability can request a reasonable accommodation. Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes communities and businesses. We are there when people need us the most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry. To be successful we must anticipate the needs of our customers reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow both ourselves and our business. National Grid is hiring a Data Science Manager for our Data Science department in Waltham MA. As a Data Science Manager at National Grid you will lead a team and do hands-on work. You will work in a dynamic organization to turn data into actionable intelligence. The variety and complexity of challenges you will solve is second to none but most important is the real world impact your work will have on the lives of millions of people. The National Grid Data Science teams provide insights and conclusions from multiple sources of information in a variety of different formats using analysis techniques that range from simple to advanced. An ability to work cross-functionally and on Agile teams is critical and you should have a broad knowledge of: Preferred Skills and Experience: National Grid is an equal opportunity employer that values a broad diversity of talent knowledge experience and expertise. We foster a culture of inclusion that drives employee engagement to deliver superior performance to the communities we serve. National Grid is proud to be an affirmative action employer. We encourage minorities women individuals with disabilities and protected veterans to join the National Grid team.Statistical & Probabilistic Analyses Programming/Software Development Effective Visualization and Presentation Lead manage and mentor a team of Data Scientists Employ sophisticated analytics programs machine learning and statistical methods for predictive and prescriptive modeling forecasting and simulations Discover the best methods of integrating data from several different sources and formats for use in analyses Project manage efforts both internal to the team and across the enterprise Be intellectually curious and enjoy learning Can manage projects both internal to the team and across the enterprise. Can supervise and mentor other team members. 4+ years of data science experience (utility or energy sector is a plus) Experience leading large projects and/or a team of individual contributors Demonstrated ability to communicate and interact with business stakeholders without supervision Demonstrated ability to translate technical knowledge into business terms Fluency in:
Machine learning tools and techniques
Python and/or R
SQL Machine learning tools and techniques Python and/or R SQL Experience with cloud computing in Linux and Windows environments (Azure is a plus) Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline exceptional candidates considered with Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree in progress Strong background in full lifecycle of Data Science products Knowledge of Agile frameworks Regulated utility experience Active github repository and stackoverflow account Data science competition entries (kaggle kdnuggets etc.) Experimental Design experience Interactive visualization tools (Power BI is a plus) GIS knowledge (ArcGIS is a plus)

desc: "We are looking for a self-driven detail oriented and motivated Sr. Machine Learning Scientist to join our fast-growing team. As a Sr. Machine Learning Scientist you’ll take the lead researching developing and applying cutting-edge machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms to build innovative technologies services and products that solve the companys hardest problems and accelerate Best Buys core growth. In this role you will combine your strong software engineering skills and deep knowledge of ML and AI algorithms to architect develop and operationalize models algorithms and production quality codebases that form the core engines that unleash the next generation of customer experiences and transform the way Best Buy operates day-to-day."Take the lead researching and developing signal processing and classification algorithms for physiological and physical activity signals mine large structured and unstructured data to appropriately glean actionable insights and use statistical methods to test data-driven hypotheses. Lead algorithm development plans machine learning algorithm design algorithm integration optimization and implementation Collaborate with software engineers embedded engineers and research scientists on product-focused teams to implement and deploy scalable solutions Lead discussions with technical and non-technical team members regarding machine learning science solutions Ensure execution and adherence to SOPs detailed project tracking and documentation. 4+ years of related experience in data analysis data modeling algorithm creation or other similar business functions Fluency with at least one machine learning science programming language (e.g. MATLAB Python R) Deep understanding of digital signal processing concepts (e.g. filtering time-frequency analysis estimation theory detection theory embedded algorithm) Demonstrated experience with machine learning (e.g. supervised/unsupervised learning methods reinforcement learning deep learning Bayesian inference etc.) Excellent verbal and written communication skills "Bachelors or advanced degree in biomedical engineering computer science electrical/electronical engineering or a related field" Master or PhD degree in biomedical engineering computer science electrical/electronical engineering or a related field Skilled at data visualization and presentation Experience with data modeling for large or complex domain opportunities Experience with human movement data (e.g. wearable sensors accelerometer etc.) or other biomedical data (e.g. electrocardiogram photoplethysmogram polysomnogram etc.) Experience with MEMS accelerometers and gyroscopes Knowledge of human physiology Ability to effectively communicate technical information to a wide spectrum of cross-functional team members Experience with working in Agile methodology would be plus

desc: Responsible for the production analysis and reporting of scheduling data to key stakeholders. Provide insight and understanding of risks and opportunities to positively influence deployment decisions with the goal of balancing workload optimizing utilization ensure timely audit delivery promoting flexibility diversity initiatives and providing broad-based experiences and developmental opportunities while balancing firm and client needs. Key point of contact to IA teams for resource and scheduling guidance and schedule input. Will be required to build relationships with all IA stakeholders and assist with queries and any ad-hoc reporting requirements. Responsible for data quality and participate in global reporting initiatives with a focus on continuous improvement through the consideration/adoption of innovative solutions to drive process efficiency. Act as point of contact for stakeholders across IA function for queries related to reporting and Operational MI as well as in support of external/regulatory exams. Continuous improvement of report content/format and processes (including the creation collection review aggregation and dissemination of data) to generate efficiencies and address relevant requirements. Identification of new opportunities to improve resourcing and scheduling decisions through own initiative and ownership of insightful analytics Work collaboratively with RMT and wider stakeholders to identify and understand pinch points with the aim of providing solutions. Provision of ad-hoc data analytics/reports for both internal (e.g. Product/Function Chief Auditors) and external stakeholders (e.g. examiners regulators). Establish strong working relationships with stakeholders and management to enable smooth co-ordination of analytic activities as well as building strong knowledge to drive insightful reporting of the control environment. "Bachelors degree preferably in Computer Science Information Systems or Data Science." Strong understanding of – and experience providing – timely high-quality insightful data analytics and reporting under tight deadlines and among multiple competing deliverables with flexibility to prioritize workload accordingly. Excellent quantitative and qualitative analytical skills with a proven ability to operate in a manually intensive data environment extracting large volumes of data from disparate sources cleansing and validating it and transforming it into high quality insightful and succinct ‘Board-level’ and senior management reporting that includes focused analysis trending and strong summarization of results. High level of proficiency in SQL to facilitate data extraction and analysis efforts. Must have high-level proficiency in MS Excel functions and other MS Office programs. Strongly prefer financial services or professional services experience. Prefer VBA knowledge. Prefer experience in mainstream BI tools: MicroStrategy QlikView Power BI etc. SharePoint knowledge including development/creation of lists document libraries etc. Prefer Basic/Intermediate level of proficiency in Python.
