title: data architect
desc: As senior member of the Digital Data team the head of data architecture will play a hands-on leadership role to lead develop and enhance the data architecture team. He or She will be responsible for the overall data architecture coherence and state of the art data platforms. Digital Data architecture team is in charge of setting the enterprise standards reviewing and/or implementing solutions and services transversally in collaboration with the different data verticals (Data engineering Data Dev Ops visual engineering Data Domain functions). This leader will ensure internal and external solutions are consistent to the overall strategies across Sanofi relevant roadmaps and internal standards where appropriate. The position will report directly to the Global Head of Data architecture Operations and Governance. This role will closely work with multiple transversal Digital teams (e.g. Data Agile CoE Consumer Experience Architecture committees) Digital Technology (e.g. infrastructure cloud network cybersecurity) and key business stakeholders. Efforts will also include developing and reviewing business cases and identifying potential technologies that could support business capabilities and their digital transformations. This resource will have direct people management responsibilities and accountability for several teams: Data Architects – technical solution architects supporting the Digital Data priorities within business & analytic Real-World evidence R&D industrial affairs ... Portfolio and Project Planning – Work closely with the program team and be in charge of defining priorities resources and budgets. This resource will also drive continuous improvements within their scope inclusive of documentation processes governance success measurement criteria and operating models. KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS: Have solid experience in developing Data architecture roadmaps blueprints and designing real world solutions. Experience with both Waterfall and Agile methodologies. Possess practical knowledge of data solutions in business processes and business decisions. Pharmaceutical and life science experience is a nice to have. Demonstrate excellent skills of translating requirements into workable fit for purpose technical designs and solutions. Have extensive experience on technical solution identification and rationalization. Previous Hands-on experience in delivering and leading Data Science and machine learning projects Proven experience in all phases of a Big Data/Analytics project: Concept & design development implementation change and operation Advanced experience in programming (Python SQL bash) Experience with Docker Kubernetes/AKS/EKS/Openshift Experience with DevOps CI/CD and MLOps automation Experience in cloud architecting and machine learning technologies – Azure/AWS/GCP Experience in data technologies Snowflake and other data warehouses informatica Kafka AWS data toolbox Airflow databricks . Experience in designing data and/or machine learning solution architectures Strong customer focus assertiveness and precise method of operation Ability in understanding of architectural dependencies of technologies in a vast and complex environment Able to communicate and present internally and externally in a confident manner Proven ability to build develop and lead teams Must be able to quickly adapt to a changing and highly dynamic work environment Strong relationship management skills in working with business colleagues Digital team members senior leadership team members and vendors Demonstrated ability to lead and/or influence decision making Resolve conflicts with tact and diplomacy Ability to communicate clearly and effectively. Fluent in English both orally and in writing. Other language skills are a plus Ability to work autonomously and work effectively with global teams to get the job done BACKGROUND: "Bachelors degree in Computer Science Engineering or related scientific or technical disciplines. Advanced degree is preferred. Additional professional certificate is a plus" >10+ years Data ML Ops experience is a plus. Strong demonstrated experience in leadership Implementation and Operational Support senior stakeholder management business partnering and clear effective communication skills. Experience leading multidisciplinary teams with direct supervisory and people management responsibilities. Sanofi Inc. and its U.S. affiliates are Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employers committed to a culturally diverse workforce. title: data science
desc:
By clicking the “Apply” button I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge. Takeda is a global values-based R&D-driven top 10 biopharmaceutical leader committed to discover and deliver life-transforming treatments guided by our commitment to patients our people and the planet. Our Data Sciences Institute (DSI) is made up of more than 250 quantitative scientists who harness the insight of data and digital to speed the development of highly innovative
treatments to patients. These scientists (from statistics programming outcomes research and epidemiology quantitative clinical pharmacology digital strategy library sciences and data architecture/governance) bring their expertise to our global program teams and re-imagine our disciplines. They work with novel data streams including real-world data and digital tools and apply advanced analytics including artificial intelligence and automation. As part of DSI the Statistics and Quantitative Sciences (SQS) at Takeda is looking to add individuals to our team that are team oriented collaborative strong understanding of the
statistical programming function exceptional leaders and innovators. SQS aspires to bring safe and effective medications to the patients with our quantitative skills. We design efficient trials contribute to clinical development strategies perform high quality statistical analyses and pursue operational excellence. The objectives and overall purpose of this role include: Advance the consistent use of innovative statistical and data science methods across all stages of R&D and across all SQS TAUs/BUs and functions. Collaborate with and drive virtual team members embedded within the SQS TAUs/BUs and functions to build and deliver SQS institutional knowledge. Provide technical leadership and guidance for selected projects by consulting on clinical development and regulatory strategy. Establish strong network and collaborations with internal and external statistical experts to bring new ideas to increase drug development efficiency. Enhance Takeda’s reputation in the Statistical Quantitative and Data Sciences internal to Takeda and across the broader health care community. Delivery & Business Accountabilities Organize and drive the overall SQS strategy to develop institutional knowledge across SQS TAUs/BUs and functions to maximize the use of consistent and innovative statistical and data science methods. Promote statistical and data science methodological and software development that is driven by project needs. Coordinate multiple SQS Research Hubs of team members embedded within SQS TAUs/BUs and functions to drive innovative methods development through research documentation and education. Provide strategic vision for long-term delivery innovation. Provide statistical leadership and support to selected programs by consulting on study design endpoints analysis interpretation statistical regulatory strategy regulatory
responses and regulatory interactions. Establish strong network and collaborations with internal and external statistical experts to support development activities and bring new ideas to increase drug development
efficiency. Actively participate in external professional initiatives and organizations to identify industry best practice and its applicability in Takeda. Enhance Takeda’s reputation in statistical societies and broaden networks with regulatory academic and pharmaceutical industry statisticians. CORE ELEMENTS RELATED TO THIS ROLE Experience representing Statistics function in interactions with regulatory agencies. Advanced knowledge of clinical study designs analysis methodology and data interpretation. Advanced knowledge of pharmaceutical industry overall drug development process with expertise in the cross-functional interfaces with the Statistics function. Advanced knowledge of FDA and ICH regulations and industry standards applicable to the design analysis of clinical trials and regulatory submissions. Excellent oral and written communications skills. Specialized statistical expertise in multiple therapeutic areas and development phases. Strong interpersonal and people management skills. Strong project management skills. Strong collaborative skills and ability to work with a cross-functional team. Ability to influence inspire and motivate others without direct hierarchical authority and affect change across organizational boundaries. Technical/Functional (Line) Expertise Technical expertise across multiple TAUs with ability to drive optimized methodology in drug R&D. Leadership in functional methodology decision making to optimize the likelihood of drug R&D success across multiple TAUs/BUs. Capability to create technical strategic vision and implements long-term innovation that is aligned with global regulatory and payer policies and trends. Capability to create major technical and methodology projects and guides them to implementation across R&D. The ability to establish external network to facilitate collaborations across industry government and academia. EDUCATION: Applicant for this position should have degree in statistics/biostatistics or in other equivalent quantitative sciences along with the following specific credentials: PhD with ~12+ years experience MS with ~15 years experience BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES An ideal candidate for this position should: Provide strategic leadership Mobilize high performance from teams Influence beyond SQS and DSI Absent an approved religious or medical reason all US office-based and lab-based Takeda employees who work fully on-site or in a hybrid model (as determined by Takeda) must be fully vaccinated to work at a Takeda site or to engage with Takeda colleagues or anyone else on behalf of Takeda. US field-based employees must be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment absent an approved religious or medical reason. US employees who work at a Takeda manufacturing facility and those who work at a BioLife center or BioLife lab may be subject to different guidelines. If you are contacted by a Takeda recruiter about your job application we encourage you to seek more information on the applicable guidelines for the Business Unit/Function to which you have applied. This job posting excludes CO applicants. WHAT TAKEDA CAN OFFER YOU: 401(k) with company match and Annual Retirement Contribution Plan Tuition reimbursement Company match of charitable contributions Health & Wellness programs including onsite flu shots and health screenings Generous time off for vacation and the option to purchase additional vacation days Community Outreach Programs Discover more at takedajobs.com No Phone Calls or Recruiters Please. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION Takeda is proud in its commitment to creating a diverse workforce and providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race color religion sex sexual orientation gender identity gender expression parental status national origin age disability citizenship status genetic information or characteristics marital status status as a Vietnam era veteran special disabled veteran or other protected veteran in accordance with applicable federal state and local laws and any other characteristic protected by law. Collaborate with and drive virtual team members embedded within the SQS TAUs/BUs and functions to build and deliver SQS institutional knowledge. Provide technical leadership and guidance for selected projects by consulting on clinical development and regulatory strategy. Establish strong network and collaborations with internal and external statistical experts to bring new ideas to increase drug development efficiency. responses and regulatory interactions. Establish strong network and collaborations with internal and external statistical experts to support development activities and bring new ideas to increase drug development
efficiency. Actively participate in external professional initiatives and organizations to identify industry best practice and its applicability in Takeda. title: data scientist
desc:
Become a Part of the NIKE Inc. Team NIKE Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow think dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers leaders and visionaries. At NIKE Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game. SNKRS & NBHD comprise Nike’s consumer-led streetwear ecosystem. This multi-disciplinary team creates inspired brand-defining and inclusive products stories experiences and business models that harness the energy from our communities shape culture and create lasting emotional bonds with our consumers. WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

We’re looking for data scientists with industry experience and a passion for understanding consumer behavior. The role requires both the mathematical rigor to develop predictive and descriptive models as well as the creativity to identify new opportunities to bring value through data-driven insights and innovation. The candidate should have a history of collaborating with multi-disciplinary teams delivering work on time against a roadmap and sharing their work with non-technical audiences. A bias for action an entrepreneurial spirit and demonstrated ability to work in a rapidly changing environment are also essential. WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON

In this role you will apply contemporary data science and analytics methods to WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH

As part of the SNKRS + NBHD Data Science and Analytics team you will be working with other data scientists and analysts as well as a diverse range of multi-functional business partners. The team is in Nike’s Direct Analytics org and Insights function. NIKE Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package casual work environment a diverse and inclusive culture and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location or the role every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world. NIKE Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race color religion sex national origin age sexual orientation gender identity gender expression veteran status or disability.Extract consumer preferences and tendencies from event streams Develop algorithms to target and reward our most deserving members Predict which consumers and how many are likely to want to purchase upcoming footwear and apparel Create models and simulations to understand marketplace dynamics Design and analyze experiments to illuminate causality Be a strategic partner to business team members and lead research and analysis to inform business strategy Build stakeholder-facing tools to support decision-making Create clear and structured work to clearly communicate significant insights to a non-technical audience "Bachelors degree in Statistics Business Psychology Economics or similarly quantitative." Minimum 5 years of relevant professional experience in analytics or data science Experience working with real-world large data sets (>100GB) Ability to work in multiple data environments and perform complex joins data cleaning and feature creation using SQL or SQL-based languages (e.g. Hive) Significant experience coding in Python Demonstrable experience building positive working relationships in multi-functional teams including demonstrated success in managing through influence. Demonstrated ability to use data to influence decision-making through compelling storytelling and presentations to executive-level partners. Track record of owning high-impact work from idea to delivery Ability to manage multiple tracks of work and requirements delivered on time and accurately. Plus: advanced degree in quantitative field Plus: experience with rigorous experimentation Plus: experience creating data products and dashboards (e.g. in Tableau) Plus: passion for Nike sneakers and streetwear culture.

In accordance with guidelines regarding companies classified as Federal contractors and consistent with our core commitment of safety National Grid has made the decision to require all new hires to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated as a condition of hire. "Full vaccination" is defined as two weeks after both doses of a two-dose vaccine or two weeks since a single-dose vaccine has been administered. Anyone unable to be vaccinated either because of a religious belief or a disability can request a reasonable accommodation. Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes communities and businesses. We are there when people need us the most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry. To be successful we must anticipate the needs of our customers reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow both ourselves and our business. National Grid is hiring a Data Science Manager for our Data Science department in Waltham MA. As a Data Science Manager at National Grid you will lead a team and do hands-on work. You will work in a dynamic organization to turn data into actionable intelligence. The variety and complexity of challenges you will solve is second to none but most important is the real world impact your work will have on the lives of millions of people. The National Grid Data Science teams provide insights and conclusions from multiple sources of information in a variety of different formats using analysis techniques that range from simple to advanced. An ability to work cross-functionally and on Agile teams is critical and you should have a broad knowledge of: Preferred Skills and Experience: National Grid is an equal opportunity employer that values a broad diversity of talent knowledge experience and expertise. We foster a culture of inclusion that drives employee engagement to deliver superior performance to the communities we serve. National Grid is proud to be an affirmative action employer. We encourage minorities women individuals with disabilities and protected veterans to join the National Grid team.Statistical & Probabilistic Analyses Programming/Software Development Effective Visualization and Presentation Lead manage and mentor a team of Data Scientists Employ sophisticated analytics programs machine learning and statistical methods for predictive and prescriptive modeling forecasting and simulations Discover the best methods of integrating data from several different sources and formats for use in analyses Project manage efforts both internal to the team and across the enterprise Be intellectually curious and enjoy learning Can manage projects both internal to the team and across the enterprise. Can supervise and mentor other team members. 4+ years of data science experience (utility or energy sector is a plus) Experience leading large projects and/or a team of individual contributors Demonstrated ability to communicate and interact with business stakeholders without supervision Demonstrated ability to translate technical knowledge into business terms Fluency in:
Machine learning tools and techniques
Python and/or R
SQL Machine learning tools and techniques Python and/or R SQL Experience with cloud computing in Linux and Windows environments (Azure is a plus) Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline exceptional candidates considered with Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree in progress Strong background in full lifecycle of Data Science products Knowledge of Agile frameworks Regulated utility experience Active github repository and stackoverflow account Data science competition entries (kaggle kdnuggets etc.) Experimental Design experience Interactive visualization tools (Power BI is a plus) GIS knowledge (ArcGIS is a plus)

Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes communities and businesses. We are there when people need us the most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry. To be successful we must anticipate the needs of our customers reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow both ourselves and our business. National Grid is hiring a Lead Data Scientist for our Economics & Load Forecasting Department in Hicksville NY or Waltham MA. The Economics & Gas Forecasting team produces the gas load forecasts for National Grid as well economic analysis and insight. As a Lead Data Scientist you will develop present and defend the gas and load forecasts for our US service territory using econometric methods. Conduct advanced quantitative analyses and develop sophisticated statistical and machine learning models and optimization tools to help the company achieve its regulatory financial operational and growth goals. You will understand policy requirement and help ensure project development be aligned with regulatory perspective. You will support internal stakeholders including Supply Engineering Regulatory Strategy Finance and others. You will assist in the presentation and defense of the forecasts to regulatory bodies in MA RI and NY. You will ensure the forecasts incorporate new distributed energy resources technologies and policies. In accordance with guidelines regarding companies classified as Federal contractors and consistent with our core commitment of safety National Grid has made the decision to require all new hires to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated as a condition of hire. "Full vaccination" is defined as two weeks after both doses of a two-dose vaccine or two weeks since a single-dose vaccine has been administered. Anyone unable to be vaccinated either because of a religious belief or a disability can request a reasonable accommodation. This position has a career path which provides for advancement opportunities within and across bands as you develop and evolve in the position; gaining experience expertise and acquiring and applying technical skills. Internal candidates will be assessed and provided offers against the minimum qualifications of this role and their individual experience. National Grid is an equal opportunity employer that values a broad diversity of talent knowledge experience and expertise. We foster a culture of inclusion that drives employee engagement to deliver superior performance to the communities we serve. National Grid is proud to be an affirmative action employer. We encourage minorities women individuals with disabilities and protected veterans to join the National Grid team.Development of gas and electric load forecast using econometric methods. Perform additional analysis relating to the forecast as necessary. Ensure the forecasts properly account for distributed energy resources and new technologies and policies (e.g. energy efficiency demand response electrification of heat etc.). Develop advanced machine learning and statistical methods and sophisticated analytics programs for addressing and solving a wide range of problems across the business. Develop advanced quantitative analyses and optimization approaches to support senior management in solution and strategy design customer engagement marketing campaigns asset optimization and energy portfolio analysis and optimization such as hedging plans. Develop maintain and enhance gas load and customer growth forecasting by using appropriate modeling technologies and training the relevant teams on model usage and results interpretation. Translate functional policy into processes and procedures that drive greater efficiencies for National Grid and ensure compliance with regulations. Help interpret modeling and analysis results from regulatory and/or policy perspectives.
Update forecast processes and documentation to ensure they are efficient reviewable and reliable.
Provide expert testimony before regulators and defend the gas/electric forecasts. Respond to data request from regulatory bodies for rate cases and other proceedings.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders (including supply engineering regulator strategy) regarding forecast methodology and analysis and ensure our deliverables meet their needs.
Stay current in all policies regulatory requirements market trends and industry standards regarding customer energy use and technologies and programs impacting that use such as energy efficiency and demand response. Update forecast processes and documentation to ensure they are efficient reviewable and reliable. Provide expert testimony before regulators and defend the gas/electric forecasts. Respond to data request from regulatory bodies for rate cases and other proceedings. Collaborate with internal stakeholders (including supply engineering regulator strategy) regarding forecast methodology and analysis and ensure our deliverables meet their needs. Stay current in all policies regulatory requirements market trends and industry standards regarding customer energy use and technologies and programs impacting that use such as energy efficiency and demand response. Works well in a team. Bachelor’s (Master’s or PhD preferred) in statistics engineering (applied) mathematics computer science economics applied management science operations research or related field. Industrial experience is a plus. Strong hands-on experience and deep understanding of advanced quantitative analysis machine learning time series analysis process modeling and optimization. Experience in energy load forecasting preferred. Proficient in statistical programming languages such as to Python R Matlab SAS required. Experience in relational databases stored procedures SQL and Non-SQL database systems preferred. Experience in cloud computation preferred Experience in project management to meet agile project development preferred Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to testify before regulators and respond to regulatory data requests. Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Experience with policy or forecasting distributed resources (e.g. energy efficiency demand response electric vehicles PV storage electrification of heat etc.) preferred. Advanced Excel skills required. Power BI/Tableau skills preferred. Relevant energy industry experience in a regulated setting preferred. Highly motivated with the ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.

Actively evaluate and continuously improve the approach toolset and implementation of visual analytics and reporting Partner across data science and other functional teams to accelerate and use visualization strategies data capabilities and insights as part of the company’s integrated data offense Evolve analytics capabilities and champion visualization and dashboarding standard methodologies for UI/UX development data quality deployment and sustainable maintenance including fast iterative experimentation and measurement "Bachelors degree in Business Statistics Mathematics Economics Technology Computer Science or other related fields preferred. Will accept suitable combination of education and experience." 5+ years of relevant experience developing dashboards data visualizations analytical reports and self-service tools 2+ years leading or mentoring teams developing analytic tools visual analytics sophisticated analytics or related practices Expert level proficiency in SQL High business acumen with a passion for business reporting analysis and working with business intelligence tools and large amounts of data Proven history of analytical leadership In-depth experience in solving sophisticated problems through data and analytics including providing insights that are logical data driven simple to understand and aligned to business goals Experience working hand-in-hand with key partners (teams portfolio managers product or merchandising managers leaders etc.) to design and build data visualizations to support business performance and goals Ability to develop strong partnerships across a multi-layered fast moving results-driven organization Relevant experience in user-centered design and capturing and communicating user needs and coaching developers to promote these methods Experience in navigating sophisticated business relationships while ensuring products are designed for optimal user experience and have measurable criteria for success Expertise with visual analysis technologies such as Tableau Domo Power BI SAS QlikView JavaScript or similar tools Knowledge developing in cloud environments such as Microsoft Azure Google Cloud and AWS; MPP Big Data and NoSQL technologies like Hadoop Spark Impala Hive MongoDB HBase or Cassandra Excellent written verbal and presentation skills – a visual and verbal storyteller who can guide and develop these skills across the team Expertise in data warehousing dimensional modeling and the ability to drive standard methodologies in data management and governance Solid understanding of various database management systems like Oracle MySQL Teradata Netezza SQL Server or DB2 as well as proficiency in working with large data sets.

desc: By clicking the “Apply” button I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge. At Takeda we are a forward-looking world-class R&D organization that unlocks innovation and delivers transformative therapies to patients. By focusing R&D efforts on four therapeutic areas and other targeted investments we push the boundaries of what is possible in order to bring life-changing therapies to patients worldwide. "Join Takeda as a Head ShinrAI Center for Artificial Intelligence/ Machine Learning. Takedas ShinrAI Center for AI/ML is the newly created Center of Excellence for AI/ML. Shinrai is the Japanese word for trust. The ShinrAI Center for AI/ML represents the hub of data scientists statisticians and data engineers that will build algorithms that can be trusted by peers colleagues and patients. As part of the Data Architecture and Digital Solutions team you will report to the Head of Data Architecture and Digital Solutions." At Takeda we are transforming patient care through the development of novel specialty pharmaceuticals and best in class patient support programs. Takeda is a patient-focused company that will inspire and empower you to grow through life-changing work. Certified as a Global Top Employer Takeda offers stimulating careers encourages innovation and strives for excellence in everything we do. We foster an inclusive collaborative workplace in which our teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world. Takeda is proud in its commitment to creating a diverse workforce and providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race color religion sex sexual orientation gender identity gender expression parental status national origin age disability citizenship status genetic information or characteristics marital status status as a Vietnam era veteran special disabled veteran or other protected veteran in accordance with applicable federal state and local laws and any other characteristic protected by law. Absent an approved religious or medical reason all US office-based and lab-based Takeda employees who work fully on-site or in a hybrid model (as determined by Takeda) must be fully vaccinated to work at a Takeda site or to engage with Takeda colleagues or anyone else on behalf of Takeda. US field-based employees must be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment absent an approved religious or medical reason. US employees who work at a Takeda manufacturing facility and those who work at a BioLife center or BioLife lab may be subject to different guidelines. If you are contacted by a Takeda recruiter about your job application we encourage you to seek more information on the applicable guidelines for the Business Unit/Function to which you have applied. In accordance with the CO Equal Pay Act Colorado Applicants Are Not Permitted to Apply. #LI-SGM EEO Statement Takeda is proud in its commitment to creating a diverse workforce and providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race color religion sex sexual orientation gender identity gender expression parental status national origin age disability citizenship status genetic information or characteristics marital status status as a Vietnam era veteran special disabled veteran or other protected veteran in accordance with applicable federal state and local laws and any other characteristic protected by law.Be a thought leader in helping to further drive the three pillars of the Center of Expertise (COE): Education Evaluate and Execute. Work collaboratively with internal stakeholders and external partners to drive prioritization of opportunities across the R&D (portfolio and asset level) and lead analytical capabilities for business impact. Drive the skill development initiatives across broader R&D organization to align with capabilities in analytics and technology. Develop and implement the Strategy to drive informed decision-making and the right outcomes. Set direction and leads the evaluation of technology platforms and external vendors aligned with the Shinrai Center for AI/ML mission and vision as well as key areas of focus. Engage internal and external SMEs (e.g. digital KOLs patients academia) to refine approach to solving unmet needs and to design/identify optimal solutions. Partner with R&D leadership and learning to identify platforms and opportunities for scalable experiential digital learning (to build comfort with digital concepts and approach). Develop and maintain best practices for analytics methods in partnership with the Business Unit Data & Analytics Delivery Teams. "Expand the organizations research and analytics offerings especially in emerging analytical approaches skills and technologies focusing them on digital delivery innovation." Manage a team of machine learning scientists foster collaboration encourage their career growth and invest in skills development. Oversee the development and integration of tools applications and statistical workflows that enable interactive hypothesis-driven data analysis by scientists with diverse levels of computational and bioinformatic expertise in a dynamic research environment. PhD (or equivalent) with approximately 12 years experience or MS with approximately 15 years experience (computer science data sciences or a related field). Conversant in the pharma/biotech R&D from target discovery through clinical development Digital literacy and proven ability to drive change using novel technologies. Digital literacy and proven ability to drive change using novel technologies. Understanding of programming principles tech development and data management process. Cultural agility and experience working within a diverse and complex organizations. Team player with the ability to drive cross-disciplinary collaborations while demonstrating humility and resiliency. Experience using design thinking to problem solve (from critical needs identification to solution deployment/execution). Well-organized self-directed and customer-centric. Effective and persuasive communicator with executive presence and ability to build followership. Eternal curiosity and desire to learn. Strong external network in innovative digital technologies (e.g. innovators in academia and startups). Proven experience in failure and continuous learning mindset. Experience leading teams that have developed and deployed AI/ML models with material impact preferably in the enterprise software domain. Strong command of statistics and the science underpinning machine learning techniques and able to defend choices with math as well as real-world tradeoffs. Deep professional and technical expertise in platforms and tools development data science and/or advanced analytics preferably with exposure to the biopharma industry. Comprehensive Healthcare: Medical Dental and Vision Financial Planning & Stability: 401(k) with company match and Annual Retirement Contribution Plan Health & Wellness programs including onsite flu shots and health screenings Generous time off for vacation and the option to purchase additional vacation days Community Outreach Programs and company match of charitable contributions Family Planning Support Flexible Work Paths Tuition reimbursement

title: data science
desc: Data is at the center of everything we do. As a startup we disrupted the credit card industry by individually personalizing every credit card offer using statistical modeling and the relational database cutting edge technology in 1988! Fast-forward a few years and this little innovation and our passion for data has skyrocketed us to a Fortune 200 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making. As a Data Scientist at Capital One you’ll be part of a team that’s leading the next wave of disruption at a whole new scale using the latest in computing and machine learning technologies and operating across billions of customer records to unlock the big opportunities that help everyday people save money time and agony in their financial lives. Role Description\nIn this role you will: The Ideal Candidate is: Basic Qualifications: Preferred Qualifications: Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position and you require an accommodation please contact Capital One Recruiting at 1-800-304-9102 or via email at RecruitingAccommodation@capitalone.com. All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations. "For technical support or questions about Capital Ones recruiting process please send an email to Careers@capitalone.com" Capital One does not provide endorse nor guarantee and is not liable for third-party products services educational tools or other information available through this site. Capital One Financial is made up of several different entities. Please note that any position posted in Canada is for Capital One Canada any position posted in the United Kingdom is for Capital One Europe and any position posted in the Philippines is for Capital One Philippines Service Corp. (COPSSC).Partner with a cross-functional team of data scientists software engineers and product managers to deliver a product customers love Leverage a broad stack of technologies — Python Conda AWS H2O Spark and more — to reveal the insights hidden within huge volumes of numeric and textual data Build machine learning models through all phases of development from design through training evaluation validation and implementation Flex your interpersonal skills to translate the complexity of your work into tangible business goals Innovative. You continually research and evaluate emerging technologies. You stay current on published state-of-the-art methods technologies and applications and seek out opportunities to apply them Creative. You thrive on bringing definition to big undefined problems. You love asking questions and pushing hard to find answers. You’re not afraid to share a new idea A leader. You challenge conventional thinking and work with stakeholders to identify and improve the status quo. You’re passionate about talent development for your own team and beyond Technical. You’re comfortable with open-source languages and are passionate about developing further. You have hands-on experience developing data science solutions using open-source tools and cloud computing platforms. Bachelor’s Degree plus 6 years of experience in data analytics or Master’s Degree plus 4 years of experience in data analytics or PhD plus 1 year of experience in data analytics At least 2 years’ experience in open source programming languages for large scale data analysis At least 2 years’ experience with machine learning At least 2 years’ experience with relational databases PhD in “STEM” field (Science Technology Engineering or Mathematics) plus 3 years of experience in data analytics At least 1 year of experience working with AWS At least 4 years’ experience in Python Scala or R for large scale data analysis At least 4 years’ experience with machine learning At least 4 years’ experience with SQL

Develop advanced machine learning and statistical methods and sophisticated analytics programs for addressing and solving a wide range of problems across the business. Develop advanced quantitative analyses and optimization approaches to support senior management in solution and strategy design customer engagement marketing campaigns asset optimization and energy portfolio analysis and optimization such as hedging plans. Develop maintain and enhance gas load and customer growth forecasting by using appropriate modeling technologies and training the relevant teams on model usage and results interpretation. Translate functional policy into processes and procedures that drive greater efficiencies for National Grid and ensure compliance with regulations. Help interpret modeling and analysis results from regulatory and/or policy perspectives.
Update forecast processes and documentation to ensure they are efficient reviewable and reliable.
Provide expert testimony before regulators and defend the gas/electric forecasts. Respond to data request from regulatory bodies for rate cases and other proceedings.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders (including supply engineering regulator strategy) regarding forecast methodology and analysis and ensure our deliverables meet their needs.
Stay current in all policies regulatory requirements market trends and industry standards regarding customer energy use and technologies and programs impacting that use such as energy efficiency and demand response. Update forecast processes and documentation to ensure they are efficient reviewable and reliable. Provide expert testimony before regulators and defend the gas/electric forecasts. Respond to data request from regulatory bodies for rate cases and other proceedings. Collaborate with internal stakeholders (including supply engineering regulator strategy) regarding forecast methodology and analysis and ensure our deliverables meet their needs. Stay current in all policies regulatory requirements market trends and industry standards regarding customer energy use and technologies and programs impacting that use such as energy efficiency and demand response. Works well in a team. Bachelor’s (Master’s or PhD preferred) in statistics engineering (applied) mathematics computer science economics applied management science operations research or related field. Industrial experience is a plus. Strong hands-on experience and deep understanding of advanced quantitative analysis machine learning time series analysis process modeling and optimization. Experience in energy load forecasting preferred. Proficient in statistical programming languages such as to Python R Matlab SAS required. Experience in relational databases stored procedures SQL and Non-SQL database systems preferred. Experience in cloud computation preferred Experience in project management to meet agile project development preferred Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to testify before regulators and respond to regulatory data requests. Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Experience with policy or forecasting distributed resources (e.g. energy efficiency demand response electric vehicles PV storage electrification of heat etc.) preferred. Advanced Excel skills required. Power BI/Tableau skills preferred. Relevant energy industry experience in a regulated setting preferred. Highly motivated with the ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.

desc:
By clicking the “Apply” button I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge. Takeda is a global values-based R&D-driven top 10 biopharmaceutical leader committed to discover and deliver life-transforming treatments guided by our commitment to patients our people and the planet. Our Data Sciences Institute (DSI) is made up of more than 250 quantitative scientists who harness the insight of data and digital to speed the development of highly innovative
treatments to patients. These scientists (from statistics programming outcomes research and epidemiology quantitative clinical pharmacology digital strategy library sciences and data architecture/governance) bring their expertise to our global program teams and re-imagine our disciplines. They work with novel data streams including real-world data and digital tools and apply advanced analytics including artificial intelligence and automation. As part of DSI the Statistics and Quantitative Sciences (SQS) at Takeda is looking to add individuals to our team that are team oriented collaborative strong understanding of the
statistical programming function exceptional leaders and innovators. SQS aspires to bring safe and effective medications to the patients with our quantitative skills. We design efficient trials contribute to clinical development strategies perform high quality statistical analyses and pursue operational excellence. The objectives and overall purpose of this role include: Advance the consistent use of innovative statistical and data science methods across all stages of R&D and across all SQS TAUs/BUs and functions. Collaborate with and drive virtual team members embedded within the SQS TAUs/BUs and functions to build and deliver SQS institutional knowledge. Provide technical leadership and guidance for selected projects by consulting on clinical development and regulatory strategy. Establish strong network and collaborations with internal and external statistical experts to bring new ideas to increase drug development efficiency. Enhance Takeda’s reputation in the Statistical Quantitative and Data Sciences internal to Takeda and across the broader health care community. Delivery & Business Accountabilities Organize and drive the overall SQS strategy to develop institutional knowledge across SQS TAUs/BUs and functions to maximize the use of consistent and innovative statistical and data science methods. Promote statistical and data science methodological and software development that is driven by project needs. Coordinate multiple SQS Research Hubs of team members embedded within SQS TAUs/BUs and functions to drive innovative methods development through research documentation and education. Provide strategic vision for long-term delivery innovation. Provide statistical leadership and support to selected programs by consulting on study design endpoints analysis interpretation statistical regulatory strategy regulatory
responses and regulatory interactions. Establish strong network and collaborations with internal and external statistical experts to support development activities and bring new ideas to increase drug development
efficiency. Actively participate in external professional initiatives and organizations to identify industry best practice and its applicability in Takeda. Enhance Takeda’s reputation in statistical societies and broaden networks with regulatory academic and pharmaceutical industry statisticians. CORE ELEMENTS RELATED TO THIS ROLE Experience representing Statistics function in interactions with regulatory agencies. Advanced knowledge of clinical study designs analysis methodology and data interpretation. Advanced knowledge of pharmaceutical industry overall drug development process with expertise in the cross-functional interfaces with the Statistics function. Advanced knowledge of FDA and ICH regulations and industry standards applicable to the design analysis of clinical trials and regulatory submissions. Excellent oral and written communications skills. Specialized statistical expertise in multiple therapeutic areas and development phases. Strong interpersonal and people management skills. Strong project management skills. Strong collaborative skills and ability to work with a cross-functional team. Ability to influence inspire and motivate others without direct hierarchical authority and affect change across organizational boundaries. Technical/Functional (Line) Expertise Technical expertise across multiple TAUs with ability to drive optimized methodology in drug R&D. Leadership in functional methodology decision making to optimize the likelihood of drug R&D success across multiple TAUs/BUs. Capability to create technical strategic vision and implements long-term innovation that is aligned with global regulatory and payer policies and trends. Capability to create major technical and methodology projects and guides them to implementation across R&D. The ability to establish external network to facilitate collaborations across industry government and academia. EDUCATION: Applicant for this position should have degree in statistics/biostatistics or in other equivalent quantitative sciences along with the following specific credentials: PhD with ~12+ years experience MS with ~15 years experience BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES An ideal candidate for this position should: Provide strategic leadership Mobilize high performance from teams Influence beyond SQS and DSI Absent an approved religious or medical reason all US office-based and lab-based Takeda employees who work fully on-site or in a hybrid model (as determined by Takeda) must be fully vaccinated to work at a Takeda site or to engage with Takeda colleagues or anyone else on behalf of Takeda. US field-based employees must be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment absent an approved religious or medical reason. US employees who work at a Takeda manufacturing facility and those who work at a BioLife center or BioLife lab may be subject to different guidelines. If you are contacted by a Takeda recruiter about your job application we encourage you to seek more information on the applicable guidelines for the Business Unit/Function to which you have applied. This job posting excludes CO applicants. WHAT TAKEDA CAN OFFER YOU: 401(k) with company match and Annual Retirement Contribution Plan Tuition reimbursement Company match of charitable contributions Health & Wellness programs including onsite flu shots and health screenings Generous time off for vacation and the option to purchase additional vacation days Community Outreach Programs Discover more at takedajobs.com No Phone Calls or Recruiters Please. desc: Become a Part of the NIKE Inc. Team NIKE Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow think dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers leaders and visionaries. At NIKE Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game. We are looking for a Sr. Director Consumer Insights and Analytics. This role will lead “the voice of the Jordan consumer” and provide meaningful data-based insights. We need this individual to bring a strategic perspective on the consumer and their relationship to basketball culture. We need a strong influential leader with deep expertise in driving insights analytics and strategy! This role will be a critical part of the leadership team of Global Jordan Consumer Science + Insights team and the lead for North America Jordan Brand Insights and Analytics. Through partnership with the other marketplace units with strong functional expertise this team powers the geography’s consumer strategy applying quantitative and qualitative methods at the pace of the consumer. The Sr. Director will partner across other multi-disciplinary analytics teams at Nike and Jordan building and owning relationships with diverse business partners. You will also partner with Gender Leaders within Jordan North America to prioritize opportunities and build a pipeline of insights and data that helps inform every aspect of our value chain. NIKE Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package casual work environment a diverse and inclusive culture and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location or the role every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world. NIKE Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race color religion sex national origin age sexual orientation gender identity gender expression veteran status or disability.Synthesize quantitative and qualitative data to drive macro business strategies that will enable North America to reach its revenue goals through the gender offense leading with a deep understanding of Jordan consumers and Nike Direct members Be the advocate for the Jordan Brand consumer in North America ensuring we are meeting their needs in an evolving marketplace by influencing analytics work done across the analytics functions: Nike Direct Commercial and Reporting Evangelize fact-based decision making at the Jordan Brand leadership table – partnering with North America Jordan Team Gender functional leaders (Nike) and their teams to improve data literacy and elevate the role of insights to inform long term strategies and seasonal planning/execution Influence the Global Jordan Brand agenda on behalf of the geography by elevating data infused priorities that will be surfaced to the global gender table through the Jordan Brand North America GM in partnership with Global Consumer Market Research Find opportunities to drive growth aligned with North America strategic priorities "Bachelors degree or higher or equivalent combination of education and experience and training" 10+ years in Data Science Advanced Analytics and/or Consumer Insights Applied experience interpreting qualitative and quantitative data to drive business decisions that will enable membership and revenue growth across the integrated marketplace in North America. 5 or more years of demonstrated ability influencing a multidisciplinary team and a proven history of analytical team leadership communications and building business partner relationships Validated achievements in solving real-world advanced analytics challenges and leading a sophisticated portfolio and multiple partners in a fast paced dynamic and matrixed team and business environment Experience building and implementing strategic business processes within a large organization including working with technology partners to deliver information solutions Excellent written presentation and verbal communication up to the senior executive level and out to wide diverse audiences Ability to successfully navigate a highly matrixed organization and work closely with teams across segments of the company Familiarity with very large data sources and best-in-class research methods and applied statistics including sampling approaches causal modeling time series analysis and data-mining techniques in collecting and predicting consumer sentiment behavior and feedback

title: data analyst
desc: "Remote is solving global remote organizations’ biggest challenge: employing anyone anywhere compliantly. We make it possible for businesses big and small to employ a global team by handling global payroll benefits taxes and compliance (learn more about how it works). Were backed by A+ investors and our team is world-class literally and figuratively as were all scattered around the world." Please check out our public handbook to learn more about our culture. We encourage folks from all ethnic groups genders sexuality age and abilities to apply. You can also check out independent reviews by other candidates on Glassdoor. If this job description resonates with you we want to hear from you! All of our positions are fully remote. You do not have to relocate to join us! We love working async and this means you get to do your own schedule. We empower ownership and proactivity and when in doubt default to action instead of waiting. "As a Data Analyst you will be the link between data producers and data consumers at Remote. Youll primarily focus on building out our data pipeline to unify our various data sources in a compliant manner. That being said you should also be able to jump in as needed and help deliver consumable data to internal users." Remote’s Total Rewards philosophy is to ensure fair unbiased compensation and fair pay along with competitive benefits in all locations in which we operate. We do not agree to or encourage cheap-labour practices and therefore pay a minimum annual salary of USD 40000 per year in all locations throughout the world. Actual compensation may vary based upon geographical location experience and/or skill level. However it will never be below our minimum global compensation mentioned. "You can learn more about the benefits were offering to all internal employees at Remote by visiting our public Benefits & Perks Handbook page." Please fill out the form below. Thank you!2+ years of experience in data analytics data science or other relevant experience; high-growth tech experience a plus Proficiency in SQL & Python Experience with Metabase or other data visualization tools Strong ability to collaborate and build effective relationships at various levels and across different roles in the organization A self-starter mentality and the ability to thrive in an unstructured and fast-paced environment You are a kind empathetic and patient person You care deeply about diversity and inclusion Writes and speaks fluent English "Its not required to have experience working remotely but considered a plus" Design build automate & own robust and scalable reporting for both internal and external partners Manage reporting and accuracy of key data metrics used for operational and decision-making Work with other teams to define key metrics and build dashboards to monitor and analyze performance Build strong documentation around data definitions Define the data needs of the org "Youll report to: Head of Automation" Team: Automation Location: Anywhere in the World Start date: As soon as possible (async) Profile review Interview with recruiter Interview with future manager (async) Small challenge (async) Challenge Review Interview with team members (no managers present) Prior employment verification check(s) (async) Offer

Consultant/Analyst/Healthcare Planner II & III The Innova Group is searching for a qualified Consultant/ Analyst/Healthcare Planner II & III to join our multidisciplinary planning team and support all aspects of project research analysis and deliverable development. The selected candidate for this position will analyze assist and develop innovative planning solutions for strategic operational and/or facility planning issues for a multitude of service lines with healthcare system clients. The most successful candidates will demonstrate skills and experience in a blend of data science analytics data management and healthcare planning. The Innova Group is a Healthcare Planning Consultancy with offices and staff in Austin Atlanta Boston Dallas Denver Minneapolis Portland St. Louis Tucson and Washington DC. Since 1995 we have been developing innovative solutions in healthcare strategy operations and facility planning both nationally and overseas. We offer a small entrepreneurial team culture with direct leadership mentoring training and involvement. We work primarily on the “pre-design” portion of a capital investment project to build healthcare facilities —working with clients to ensure the project meets strategic financial and operational goals— setting the table for architectural design and real estate acquisition process. The Innova Group is a source of strategic healthcare planning and consulting services for large private systems such as Kaiser Permanente and Dignity Health academic medical centers such as the University of New Mexico community hospitals and public sector systems such as the Military Health Service Indian Health Service and Veterans Affairs. More information on our firm is available at www.theinnovagroup.com. Salary Range: Level II: $65000-100000 Level III: $100000-150000 dependent upon experience and qualifications Job Description Qualifications Required Statistics Economics Applied Mathematics Architecture GIS or other data/analysis intensive major Technical Skills Considered Location/Benefits/Travel These positions are being offered nation-wide with preferences for communities with an existing Innova presence and Tucson. Depending on experience the Healthcare Planner II positions may require an in- office position in Austin Dallas Denver Minneapolis St. Louis or Tucson. We offer paid vacation healthcare healthcare savings account 401K and profit-sharing benefits. Compensation will be commensurate with qualifications and experience. Six to ten days travel per month may be required of this position. Application Requirements Interested individuals should submit an electronic (word or pdf) copy of their resume with a cover letter. A cover letter is essential and should clearly identify your career goal your rationale for applying a summary of your education and past work experience and why you are a good fit for the position. Submissions without a cover letter will not be accepted. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race color religion sex sexual orientation gender identity or national origin. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $65000.00 - $150000.00 per year Benefits: Schedule: Ability to commute/relocate: Application Question(s): Education: Experience: Willingness to travel: Work Location: Multiple LocationsAcquire normalize and analyze multi-sector medical data (patient/facility/physician) utilized in modeling healthcare delivery and developing operational alternatives for healthcare systems Forecast future healthcare utilization through trend analysis and extrapolation Present and display data analysis and findings to help clients make decisions Demonstrate expertise utilizing healthcare strategy planning metrics and emerging trends to define operational processes and resource requirements (capital space and staff) in healthcare planning documents for clinical staff administrators and architects Assist and conduct strategy operations and facility evaluations Assist and conduct Facility Master Plans and Regional Health Care System planning Lead facilitate guide and oversee analysis and planning on multiple project types and client sectors Bachelor’s and/or master’s degree in one of the following programs: Healthcare Business Level II: 4 -10 years of experience in healthcare strategy operations and/or facility planning Level III: 10-15 years of experience in healthcare strategy operations and/or facility planning Broad knowledge of healthcare services delivery models data sets related codes and facility finance and/or operation related planning metrics Ability to create and communicate relevant solutions to complex problems through thoughtful and analysis Public Speaking Demonstrated team player with mentoring and/or leadership skills MS Office: Outlook Word PowerPoint and Excel (intermediate proficiency required - Pivot tables complex “if” statements conditional formatting) SQL: intermediate proficiency (import data indices query/table development CTE creation etc.). Database and/or application development skills GIS Experience Graphics capability (Graphic Design/Media/Other Dimensions) Business Intelligence Tools o Tableau o Power Bi Experience related to Innova core sectors (healthcare strategy/operations/facility planning) Familiarity with CAD standards/procedures as well as Revit are desirable but not required. When attaching your resume please use following filename style: " last name_first name_resume.doc/pdf" (for example if your name was Chris Miller and you were submitting a pdf file your resume would be saved as "miller_chris_resume.pdf". Your cover letter may be copy/pasted directly into the box provided in the Indeed.com submission process. The Innova Group does not compensate candidates for travel expenses associated with interviewing unless otherwise indicated at the time of call for interview. 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Monday to Friday Dallas TX: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Are you comfortable with public speaking? Do you presently hold a leadership or mentoring position within your current organization? How many years of healthcare operations experience do you have? How many years of healthcare strategy experience do you have? How many years of facility planning experience do you have? Are you willing to relocate to Tucson Austin or Dallas where The Innova Group has a presence? "Bachelors (Required)" Healthcare management: 4 years (Required) 50% (Preferred)

job_title: DATA ANALYTICS MANAGER I (GLOBAL COMMERCIAL ANALYTICS- S&IP OPTIMIZATION)

desc: Become a Part of the NIKE Inc. Team NIKE Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow think dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers leaders and visionaries. At NIKE Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game. "NIKE Inc. does more than outfit the worlds best athletes. It is a place to explore potential obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow think dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers leaders and visionaries. At Nike it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game." Analytics is a competitive differentiator for Nike and is fundamentally changing how the company serves athletes and consumers around the world. The Nike Commercial Analytics team builds analytic-based solutions to manage marketplace and optimize the supply chain. Using big data advanced analytics and state-of-the-art technology the team strives to ensure that Nike gets the right product to the right place at the right time for the consumers. We are looking for a Data Analytics Manager I to join the Supply and Inventory Planning Optimization (SIPO) team within the larger Commercial Analytics organization. This role will be part of a multi-functional agile squad responsible for building predictive and prescriptive analytic solutions to enhance the supply and inventory decision making across Nike’s global supply chain. The candidate needs to be a dependable teammate and a self-motivated data evangelist. You are unconventionally curious especially about how data can be used to optimize the planning and management of Nike’s multi node (or multi echelon) inventory. You enjoy finding clarity and identifying relationships between disparate data sets in a muddied data environment. You are highly proficient in SQL and visualization tools (such as Tableau/Excel/Power BI) experienced in a variety of scripting languages well-versed in automation techniques and at home in a cloud based big data environment. You have a healthy degree of skepticism and the ability to speak data truth to power. You also know how to rise above the numbers and explain the essential insights to business users and you instinctively minimize complexity to focus on results. While you rely on data to prove your point you love to think in an unexpected way and solve problems creatively. You thrive in an entrepreneurial environment and you are excited by the challenge of building something from the ground up. You ask good questions are continually learning as well as finding opportunities to share knowledge with others. If this is you you will be part of the Supply and Multi Node Inventory Optimization (S&MN) squad that delivers data science / operations research products to support Nike’s critical supply and inventory planning (S&IP) decisions including integrated multi-node fulfillment multi echelon inventory planning and performance management. Specifically you will: You will report to the Director of Data Science while partner on daily basis with the fellow data scientists data analysts engineers and product owner on your squad. You will collaborate across the broader organization with business teams in Demand and Supply Management (DSM) and Marketplace Operations (MPO) as well as other data analytics and technology functions at Nike. NIKE Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package casual work environment a diverse and inclusive culture and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location or the role every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world. NIKE Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race color religion sex national origin age sexual orientation gender identity gender expression veteran status or disability. NIKE Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package casual work environment a diverse and inclusive culture and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location or the role every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world. NIKE Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race color religion sex national origin age sexual orientation gender identity gender expression veteran status or disability.Identify and apply appropriate methods to acquire explore cleanse and fuse data from different sources. Produce datasets insights visualization and reports for analysis using system reporting tools. Translate complex business problem statements into analysis requirements and work with internal customers to define the analytic product details based on expressed partner needs. Develop quantitative research to identify explore troubleshoot and solve problems related to data coverage and quality. Build and implement reporting tools and ad hoc analysis to pull together relevant data provide trending/KPI reporting and evaluate metrics to drive business against established goals. Participate in the development of new analytical models and improve existing approaches based on operations research techniques and big data solutions to determine optimal level of inventory capacity and supply plan. Support a portfolio of consumers and related analytics projects with multiple business partners on firm deadlines. Synthesize and package complex analyses making them understandable across technical and non-technical audiences "Bachelors degree in Business Data Science Supply Chain Management Operations Research Statistics Mathematics Economics or other related fields." Minimum 2 years of relevant professional experience with an emphasis on building data and analytical products. Supply chain/Logistics or Retail industry experience strongly preferred. Proficient in data wrangling SQL skills and visualization tools (e.g. Tableau/Power BI). Demonstrable ability to sift through data understand statistical analysis identify critical information and develop solution options. Demonstrated ability to think critically and seamlessly collaborate with business process owners and data science and engineering partners. Working knowledge of Scrum and agile principles. Experience in data analysis/visualization packages in R or Python is a plus. Experience with Git and Amazon Web Services preferred. Excellent written and verbal communication skills including ability to develop and deliver presentation.
