desc: By clicking the “Apply” button I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge. At Takeda we are a forward-looking world-class R&D organization that unlocks innovation and delivers transformative therapies to patients. By focusing R&D efforts on four therapeutic areas and other targeted investments we push the boundaries of what is possible in order to bring life-changing therapies to patients worldwide. "Join Takeda as a Head ShinrAI Center for Artificial Intelligence/ Machine Learning. Takedas ShinrAI Center for AI/ML is the newly created Center of Excellence for AI/ML. Shinrai is the Japanese word for trust. The ShinrAI Center for AI/ML represents the hub of data scientists statisticians and data engineers that will build algorithms that can be trusted by peers colleagues and patients. As part of the Data Architecture and Digital Solutions team you will report to the Head of Data Architecture and Digital Solutions." At Takeda we are transforming patient care through the development of novel specialty pharmaceuticals and best in class patient support programs. Takeda is a patient-focused company that will inspire and empower you to grow through life-changing work. Certified as a Global Top Employer Takeda offers stimulating careers encourages innovation and strives for excellence in everything we do. We foster an inclusive collaborative workplace in which our teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world. Takeda is proud in its commitment to creating a diverse workforce and providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race color religion sex sexual orientation gender identity gender expression parental status national origin age disability citizenship status genetic information or characteristics marital status status as a Vietnam era veteran special disabled veteran or other protected veteran in accordance with applicable federal state and local laws and any other characteristic protected by law. Absent an approved religious or medical reason all US office-based and lab-based Takeda employees who work fully on-site or in a hybrid model (as determined by Takeda) must be fully vaccinated to work at a Takeda site or to engage with Takeda colleagues or anyone else on behalf of Takeda. US field-based employees must be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment absent an approved religious or medical reason. US employees who work at a Takeda manufacturing facility and those who work at a BioLife center or BioLife lab may be subject to different guidelines. If you are contacted by a Takeda recruiter about your job application we encourage you to seek more information on the applicable guidelines for the Business Unit/Function to which you have applied. In accordance with the CO Equal Pay Act Colorado Applicants Are Not Permitted to Apply. #LI-SGM EEO Statement Takeda is proud in its commitment to creating a diverse workforce and providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race color religion sex sexual orientation gender identity gender expression parental status national origin age disability citizenship status genetic information or characteristics marital status status as a Vietnam era veteran special disabled veteran or other protected veteran in accordance with applicable federal state and local laws and any other characteristic protected by law.Be a thought leader in helping to further drive the three pillars of the Center of Expertise (COE): Education Evaluate and Execute. Work collaboratively with internal stakeholders and external partners to drive prioritization of opportunities across the R&D (portfolio and asset level) and lead analytical capabilities for business impact. Drive the skill development initiatives across broader R&D organization to align with capabilities in analytics and technology. Develop and implement the Strategy to drive informed decision-making and the right outcomes. Set direction and leads the evaluation of technology platforms and external vendors aligned with the Shinrai Center for AI/ML mission and vision as well as key areas of focus. Engage internal and external SMEs (e.g. digital KOLs patients academia) to refine approach to solving unmet needs and to design/identify optimal solutions. Partner with R&D leadership and learning to identify platforms and opportunities for scalable experiential digital learning (to build comfort with digital concepts and approach). Develop and maintain best practices for analytics methods in partnership with the Business Unit Data & Analytics Delivery Teams. "Expand the organizations research and analytics offerings especially in emerging analytical approaches skills and technologies focusing them on digital delivery innovation." Manage a team of machine learning scientists foster collaboration encourage their career growth and invest in skills development. Oversee the development and integration of tools applications and statistical workflows that enable interactive hypothesis-driven data analysis by scientists with diverse levels of computational and bioinformatic expertise in a dynamic research environment. PhD (or equivalent) with approximately 12 years experience or MS with approximately 15 years experience (computer science data sciences or a related field). Conversant in the pharma/biotech R&D from target discovery through clinical development Digital literacy and proven ability to drive change using novel technologies. Digital literacy and proven ability to drive change using novel technologies. Understanding of programming principles tech development and data management process. Cultural agility and experience working within a diverse and complex organizations. Team player with the ability to drive cross-disciplinary collaborations while demonstrating humility and resiliency. Experience using design thinking to problem solve (from critical needs identification to solution deployment/execution). Well-organized self-directed and customer-centric. Effective and persuasive communicator with executive presence and ability to build followership. Eternal curiosity and desire to learn. Strong external network in innovative digital technologies (e.g. innovators in academia and startups). Proven experience in failure and continuous learning mindset. Experience leading teams that have developed and deployed AI/ML models with material impact preferably in the enterprise software domain. Strong command of statistics and the science underpinning machine learning techniques and able to defend choices with math as well as real-world tradeoffs. Deep professional and technical expertise in platforms and tools development data science and/or advanced analytics preferably with exposure to the biopharma industry. Comprehensive Healthcare: Medical Dental and Vision Financial Planning & Stability: 401(k) with company match and Annual Retirement Contribution Plan Health & Wellness programs including onsite flu shots and health screenings Generous time off for vacation and the option to purchase additional vacation days Community Outreach Programs and company match of charitable contributions Family Planning Support Flexible Work Paths Tuition reimbursement

title: data scientist
desc: Piper Companies is seeking a Fully Remote Data Scientist to join one of the nation’s largest premier credit unions. The Data Scientist will implement quantitative models to analyze credit and prepayment risk determine the allowance for loan losses and support financial planning. Responsibilities of the Data Scientist include: Qualifications for the Data Scientist include: Compensation for the Data Scientist include: Keywords: Data data science R sas python datasets logistic regression linear regression survival analysis time series analysis decision trees cluster analysis real estate auto credit card consumer lending consumer banking modeling model implementation model risk documentation prepayment risk financial servicesImplement models for loan loss allowance CECL stress testing new volume origination line of credit utilization and prepayment models for all products including credit card personal loan student loan auto loan mortgage and commercial loan. Maintaining documentation for key processes and model components across the team with a focus on standardization of processes that satisfy model risk management audit and regulatory requirements. Implement vendor-developed models for consumer and commercial credit loss or prepayment. Monitor performance of quantitative models and support independent model validation efforts in accordance with the model risk management policy. Establish and document model implementation controls that satisfy model risk management audit and regulatory requirements. 2+ years of experience in quantitative modeling development or implementation. Working experience in data manipulation and advanced data analysis. Experience with SAS R Python and proficiency working with large datasets is required. Applied experience with Logistic Regression Linear Regression Survival Analysis Time Series Analysis Decision Trees and Cluster Analysis. Experience in at least one (1) of the following areas is preferred; real estate products auto credit card student loan or commercial loan. Hourly Pay: $50 - $55/hr - Salary Range: $100000-$150000 + Bonus Package **depending on experience** Full benefits: PTO Paid Holidays Cigna Healthcare Dental Vision 401k with ADPTS

title: data engineer
desc:
"Interactive Consulting Services Inc.s (ICS) mission is to match elite talent with cutting-edge technologies and projects." Interactive Consulting Services (ICS) is headquartered in Jarrettsville MD and has been providing IT and talent services for over 20 years. ICS has a proven track record in both the public and private sectors providing talent and solutions in fields ranging from healthcare education and finance to social services defense and aviation. Responsibilities: · Develop data mining and collection procedures · Create and manage the big data research environment · Ensure data quality and integrity · Productize machine learning algorithms · Visualize data and create reports from production systems · Deploy and monitor production systems · Ensure system scalability for new algorithms and product updates Description: We are searching for a Lead Data Engineer to lead engineering activities for a high-tech research and development team. This individual will help us implement a system to interpret large quantities of medical records using the latest cutting-edge technologies. This is a long-term project for a major federal agency. To be successful in this position you should have strong problem-solving skills and an expert understanding of both statistical analysis and engineering. You should also enjoy researching and implementing the latest data science algorithms and tools. If you enjoy solving complex problems and enjoy mentoring team members we’d love to meet you! Requirements: · Proven experience as a Data Engineer Data Scientist or similar role · Solid understanding of machine learning tools and algorithms · Knowledge of data management and visualization techniques · Excellent knowledge of Python R and SageMaker · Excellent understanding of how to optimize production systems · Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases (MongoDB is a plus) · Excellent communication skills · BS in Computer Science Data Science Mathematics or similar field Work Authorization:
US Citizen Green Card H1-B Visa
Background Check/Public Trust Clearance:
Active clearance is NOT required but candidate must be able to obtain and maintain a US Public Trust clearance Job Type: Full-time Pay: $150000.00 - $200000.00 per year Schedule: Education: Experience: Work Location: Remote8 hour shift Monday to Friday "Bachelors (Preferred)" SQL: 1 year (Preferred)

title: data science
desc: Become a Part of the NIKE Inc. Team NIKE Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow think dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers leaders and visionaries. At NIKE Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game. WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR We are looking for a seasoned data science leader for our Digital Experiences Data Science team. The Senior Director of Digital Experiences role will be responsible for leading the data science teams that work on optimizing and personalizing Nike’s digital experiences. These experiences include both Nike.com and on the Nike app in the United States China Europe and elsewhere around the globe as well as Nike’s SNKRS and WeChat apps. Today this body of work is focused on using machine learning for search relevance and product recommendations. The aim is to leverage data science more broadly across these digital platforms. WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON You will… WHO WILL YOU WORK WITH You will be the leader of the Digital Experiences Data Science team reporting to the Vice President of Consumer Data Science. Digital Experiences Data Science is part of Nike’s Consumer Data Science sub-function and Insights and Analytics function. So you will be a member of the broader data science and analytics community at Nike and help organize and participate in our data science labs study groups and team activities and attend conferences. WHAT YOU BRING NIKE Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package casual work environment a diverse and inclusive culture and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location or the role every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world. NIKE Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race color religion sex national origin age sexual orientation gender identity gender expression veteran status or disability.Partner closely with the other data science leaders within Consumer Data Science. This includes aligning Digital Experience Data Science roadmaps with our those of the data science teams working in the areas of sport activity content planning and marketing communications. Reuse data and models where possible. Partner closely with Nike’s Digital Product Management leadership providing input into the overall digital roadmaps and in particular helping to identify and advocate for high leverage uses of data and data science across Nike’s digital experiences. Partner closely with Nike’s Global Technology leadership that works on data engineering platform engineering and experience engineering. Ensure that the foundational data systems and processes are in place to successfully execute on data science. Evaluate the evolving landscape of vendors of data science capabilities for ecommerce and develop a position on which capabilities should be built in house. Lead through leaders including our search and personalization data science leaders and teams that are in place today and who will report into this role. Be an inspirational thought leader within the broader analytics and data science communities at Nike. Hire onboard and mentor talented data scientists and data science leaders. Experience developing strong partnerships with engineering and product teams. Experience managing through senior managers. Experience hiring and mentoring exceptional data scientists. Experience communicating technical roadmaps to business leaders. Experience practicing data science even if not recently. A product and entrepreneurial mindset. Bachelors degree or higher or Combination of relevant education experience and training.

Consultant/Analyst/Healthcare Planner II & III The Innova Group is searching for a qualified Consultant/ Analyst/Healthcare Planner II & III to join our multidisciplinary planning team and support all aspects of project research analysis and deliverable development. The selected candidate for this position will analyze assist and develop innovative planning solutions for strategic operational and/or facility planning issues for a multitude of service lines with healthcare system clients. The most successful candidates will demonstrate skills and experience in a blend of data science analytics data management and healthcare planning. The Innova Group is a Healthcare Planning Consultancy with offices and staff in Austin Atlanta Boston Dallas Denver Minneapolis Portland St. Louis Tucson and Washington DC. Since 1995 we have been developing innovative solutions in healthcare strategy operations and facility planning both nationally and overseas. We offer a small entrepreneurial team culture with direct leadership mentoring training and involvement. We work primarily on the “pre-design” portion of a capital investment project to build healthcare facilities —working with clients to ensure the project meets strategic financial and operational goals— setting the table for architectural design and real estate acquisition process. The Innova Group is a source of strategic healthcare planning and consulting services for large private systems such as Kaiser Permanente and Dignity Health academic medical centers such as the University of New Mexico community hospitals and public sector systems such as the Military Health Service Indian Health Service and Veterans Affairs. More information on our firm is available at www.theinnovagroup.com. Salary Range: Level II: $65000-100000 Level III: $100000-150000 dependent upon experience and qualifications Job Description Qualifications Required Statistics Economics Applied Mathematics Architecture GIS or other data/analysis intensive major Technical Skills Considered Location/Benefits/Travel These positions are being offered nation-wide with preferences for communities with an existing Innova presence and Tucson. Depending on experience the Healthcare Planner II positions may require an in- office position in Austin Dallas Denver Minneapolis St. Louis or Tucson. We offer paid vacation healthcare healthcare savings account 401K and profit-sharing benefits. Compensation will be commensurate with qualifications and experience. Six to ten days travel per month may be required of this position. Application Requirements Interested individuals should submit an electronic (word or pdf) copy of their resume with a cover letter. A cover letter is essential and should clearly identify your career goal your rationale for applying a summary of your education and past work experience and why you are a good fit for the position. Submissions without a cover letter will not be accepted. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race color religion sex sexual orientation gender identity or national origin. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $65000.00 - $150000.00 per year Benefits: Schedule: Ability to commute/relocate: Application Question(s): Education: Experience: Willingness to travel: Work Location: Multiple LocationsAcquire normalize and analyze multi-sector medical data (patient/facility/physician) utilized in modeling healthcare delivery and developing operational alternatives for healthcare systems Forecast future healthcare utilization through trend analysis and extrapolation Present and display data analysis and findings to help clients make decisions Demonstrate expertise utilizing healthcare strategy planning metrics and emerging trends to define operational processes and resource requirements (capital space and staff) in healthcare planning documents for clinical staff administrators and architects Assist and conduct strategy operations and facility evaluations Assist and conduct Facility Master Plans and Regional Health Care System planning Lead facilitate guide and oversee analysis and planning on multiple project types and client sectors Bachelor’s and/or master’s degree in one of the following programs: Healthcare Business Level II: 4 -10 years of experience in healthcare strategy operations and/or facility planning Level III: 10-15 years of experience in healthcare strategy operations and/or facility planning Broad knowledge of healthcare services delivery models data sets related codes and facility finance and/or operation related planning metrics Ability to create and communicate relevant solutions to complex problems through thoughtful and analysis Public Speaking Demonstrated team player with mentoring and/or leadership skills MS Office: Outlook Word PowerPoint and Excel (intermediate proficiency required - Pivot tables complex “if” statements conditional formatting) SQL: intermediate proficiency (import data indices query/table development CTE creation etc.). Database and/or application development skills GIS Experience Graphics capability (Graphic Design/Media/Other Dimensions) Business Intelligence Tools o Tableau o Power Bi Experience related to Innova core sectors (healthcare strategy/operations/facility planning) Familiarity with CAD standards/procedures as well as Revit are desirable but not required. When attaching your resume please use following filename style: " last name_first name_resume.doc/pdf" (for example if your name was Chris Miller and you were submitting a pdf file your resume would be saved as "miller_chris_resume.pdf". Your cover letter may be copy/pasted directly into the box provided in the Indeed.com submission process. The Innova Group does not compensate candidates for travel expenses associated with interviewing unless otherwise indicated at the time of call for interview. 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Monday to Friday Tucson AZ: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Are you comfortable with public speaking? Do you presently hold a leadership or mentoring position within your current organization? How many years of healthcare operations experience do you have? How many years of healthcare strategy experience do you have? How many years of facility planning experience do you have? Are you willing to relocate to Tucson Austin or Dallas where The Innova Group has a presence? "Bachelors (Required)" Healthcare management: 4 years (Required) 50% (Preferred)

title: data science
desc:
Qualifications A PhD in Computer Science Computer Engineering Electrical Engineering or related field. Extensive knowledge and experience with advanced machine learning methods including deep learning. Experience with deep learning applications including computer vision natural language processing or other. Strong Python coding skills. Fluent with TensorFlow or PyTorch and related tools. Strong interpersonal communications skills. Experience with GANs a plus. What we offer:
Responsibilities as of Day 1 - you will feel the ownership of your project from the beginning and you will be given specific projects and responsibilities. Continuous mentorship - you will work with passionate people and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager. Work and be part of a dynamic and encouraging environment - working over a diverse array of interesting problems. Promote agility and work/life balance for employees we value every individual and support initiatives. Experience true support for work/life effectiveness and your long-term well-being. "Get a competitive salary and benefits package.
About us
We produce globally recognized brands and we grow the best business leaders in the industry. With a portfolio of trusted brands as diverse as ours it is paramount our leaders are able to lead with courage the vast array of brands categories and functions. We serve consumers around the world with one of the strongest portfolios of trusted quality leadership brands including Always® Ariel® Gillette® Head & Shoulders® Herbal Essences® Oral-B® Pampers® Pantene® Tampax® and more. Our community includes operations in approximately 70 countries worldwide." Visit http://www.pg.com to know more. Our consumers are diverse and our talents - internally - mirror this diversity to best serve it. That is why wee committed to building a winning culture based on Inclusion and our ideal candidate is passionate about the same principle: you will join our daily effort of being "in touch" so we craft brands and products to improve the lives of the world\s consumers now and in the future. We want you to inspire us with your unrivaled ideas. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race color religion sex national origin protected veteran status disability status age sexual orientation gender identity and expression marital status citizenship HIV/AIDS status or any other legally protected factor. "Immigration sponsorship is not available for this role. As a general matter Procter & Gamble does not sponsor candidates for nonimmigrant visas or permanent residency. However Procter & Gamble may make exceptions on a discretionary basis. Any exceptions would be based on the Companys specific business needs at the time and place of recruitment as well as the particular qualifications of the individual." Procter & Gamble participates in e-verify as required by law. Qualified individuals will not be disadvantaged based on being unemployed.

title: data engineer
desc: ETL Data Engineer\n\nOur data engineering team is gjobing! We are looking for someone with a strong foundation in traditional approaches to data engineering as well as more recent experience in a modern cloud - based API - driven data environment. This is an opportunity to join the Data Integration team where your primary focus is to design and build durable data pipelines. You will be working on data integration processes to enable the gjobing Business Intelligence and Data Science teams. You will work on-premise while also helping migrate to the cloud and expand both structured and unstructured data capabilities with a focus on modernizing our data pipelines and integration strategy to increase data accuracy and availability lower support cost and increase speed to shelf. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE: Required Additional Nice To Have Skills:Build performant and scalable data pipelines Create monitor and maintain data pipelines Ensures new and existing code meets company standards for readability testability automation documentation and performance Automate when possible and where it makes sense Ability to understand business processes and software systems and make technology decisions that make the most sense for the business challenges we are trying to solve Pair with other team members to increase efficiency and collaboration Continually bring features from conception to production leveraging a DevOps mindset Integrate with both existing legacy systems and new modern systems Implement process improvements and create technical documentation where needed Provide after hours on-call support on a rotational basis Mid-Sr level proficiency with Python and SQL Experience designing modeling and implementing snowflake star and relational data models. Experience using ETL / ELT tools (e.g. SSIS Informatica) and best practices Ability to independently troubleshoot issues think critically and clearly communicate findings/recommendations Automation and scripting skills Experience using workflow management/orchestration tools (Airflow) Experience working on stream-processing systems (Google Pub/Sub Kafka etc.) "We value education- whether thats in a formal university setting or knowledge youve gathered through your years of experience" Experience using CI / CD technologies(Concourse Jenkins Travis CI etc.) Experience building containerized applications (Kubernetes Docker etc.) Experience with streaming analytics (e.g. Spark Google Dataflow Azure Streaming Analytics etc.) Knowledge of cloud databases (e.g. Azure Synapse GCP BigQuery Snowflake etc.) "Experience ingesting data via APIs" Experience with centralizing data from disparate sources transforming data and resolving data conflicts Expertise in the Microsoft technologies ( SSIS / SSRS / SSAS / Azure Synapse ) and/or Google Cloud Platform technologies

title: data science
desc: LifeQ is seeking a dynamic and experienced candidate for the role of Data Science Developer. The Data Science Developer is first and foremost a software engineer but also possesses experience with Data Science methodologies and workflow patterns such as the extraction loading and transformation of data (ETL). Machine learning engineers will be well positioned to apply. LifeQ provides a fast-paced and dynamic work environment with access to industry-leading technology and collaboration with influential international corporations. The LifeQ team is fully remote-capable during the COVID-19 pandemic and will resume working in the Alpharetta GA office when it is safe to do so. LifeQ makes use of physiological behavioral and environmental data derived primarily from smart watches to produce models that quantify health status and the impact of behavioural choices. LifeQ’s solutions span several links in the IOT chain ranging from on-device libraries that operate and process sensor data up to end-user apps and patient dashboards. LifeQ is the world’s leading independent provider of wearable biometrics and our clients include several device brands. Over 20 commercial wearable device models have been enabled to date including Fortune top 10 brands. The ideal candidate will be someone with an enthusiasm for managing and designing software solutions an interest in enabling and upskilling coworkers a willingness to learn and adapt to new challenges and a drive to maximally enable innovation of Data Science centered products. Job Description The Data Science Developer will work closely with several Data Science teams running projects that incorporate a wide range of models and biologically inspired computational methods using existing data and data forthcoming from pilot initiatives. The Data Science Developer’s function is to firstly extend the capabilities of Data Science Teams by enabling them to perform rapid first iteration end-to-end prototyping of new deliverables during early product development cycles and secondly to structure and architect a common toolset for the team. In both capacities the Data Science Developer will aid new and existing Data Science team members to understand and use common toolsets and frameworks for achieving these objectives. The Data Science Developer will also interface with LifeQ’s Research Engineering team and Chief Technology Officer that manage LifeQ’s commercially deployed models to align on internal software used in the production environment. Note that the Data Science Developers role is distinct from that of a Data Scientist. Data Science Developers combine software engineering skills with Data Science capabilities. The Data Science Developer will report to the company’s Chief Science Officer. Responsibilities Skills Data Science Developers are first and foremost software engineers but also possess some experience wrt Data Science concepts and workflow patterns such as the extraction loading and transformation of data (ETL). Candidates meeting these requirements are invited to apply. Work experience and qualifications Ranked by relevance Specific proficiencies Ranked by relevanceCreate new components and leverage existing software infrastructure for deploying existing data science models as end-to-end prototypes for first rounds of internal testing Support benchmarking A/B testing and status monitoring of the above end-to-end prototypes Enable and upskill Data Science teams to make use of the above infrastructure for new models in development Meet with Data Science teams to regularly review and to lead restructuring of their shared codebase for training models on big data Creating documentation for all software created by the Data Science Developer to be used by the Data Science teams Staying abreast of developments in the Data Science industry to ensure the team’s software tools are up to date. Enable and upskill the Data Science teams wrt coding practice documentation and software tools Keeping a central inventory of all project code created by Data Science teams Consulting with the Chief Technology Officer and Research Engineering team to maintain an up to date understanding of the commercial production environment that Data Science end-to-end prototypes will be translated to. Consulting with the Chief Science Officer to determine and refine objectives Experience as Data Science Developer or Machine Learning Engineer 3 years of software development experience relevant to the role "Bachelors degree in computer science electronic engineering or related STEM field" Master’s degree in data analytics data science or similar will be advantageous. Experience in prototype deployment: AWS serverless environment and Lambdas Kafka or other applicable frameworks Experience in Machine Learning frameworks libraries data structures data modeling and software architecture Great communication and collaboration skills Excellent time management and organizational abilities. Superb analytical and problem-solving abilities Advanced proficiency in Python Experience with Docker REST APIs Code repository management Experience in C Go Scala Javascript C++ Java In-depth knowledge of mathematics statistics and algorithms

desc:
"Interactive Consulting Services Inc.s (ICS) mission is to match elite talent with cutting-edge technologies and projects." Interactive Consulting Services (ICS) is headquartered in Jarrettsville MD and has been providing IT and talent services for over 20 years. ICS has a proven track record in both the public and private sectors providing talent and solutions in fields ranging from healthcare education and finance to social services defense and aviation. This is a long-term project for a major federal agency. To be successful in this position you should have strong problem-solving skills and an expert understanding of statistical analysis. You should also enjoy researching and implementing the latest data science algorithms and tools. desc: By clicking the “Apply” button I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge. At Takeda we are a forward-looking world-class R&D organization that unlocks innovation and delivers transformative therapies to patients. By focusing R&D efforts on four therapeutic areas and other targeted investments we push the boundaries of what is possible in order to bring life-changing therapies to patients worldwide. "Join Takeda as a Head ShinrAI Center for Artificial Intelligence/ Machine Learning. Takedas ShinrAI Center for AI/ML is the newly created Center of Excellence for AI/ML. Shinrai is the Japanese word for trust. The ShinrAI Center for AI/ML represents the hub of data scientists statisticians and data engineers that will build algorithms that can be trusted by peers colleagues and patients. As part of the Data Architecture and Digital Solutions team you will report to the Head of Data Architecture and Digital Solutions." At Takeda we are transforming patient care through the development of novel specialty pharmaceuticals and best in class patient support programs. Takeda is a patient-focused company that will inspire and empower you to grow through life-changing work. Certified as a Global Top Employer Takeda offers stimulating careers encourages innovation and strives for excellence in everything we do. We foster an inclusive collaborative workplace in which our teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world. Takeda is proud in its commitment to creating a diverse workforce and providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race color religion sex sexual orientation gender identity gender expression parental status national origin age disability citizenship status genetic information or characteristics marital status status as a Vietnam era veteran special disabled veteran or other protected veteran in accordance with applicable federal state and local laws and any other characteristic protected by law. Absent an approved religious or medical reason all US office-based and lab-based Takeda employees who work fully on-site or in a hybrid model (as determined by Takeda) must be fully vaccinated to work at a Takeda site or to engage with Takeda colleagues or anyone else on behalf of Takeda. US field-based employees must be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment absent an approved religious or medical reason. US employees who work at a Takeda manufacturing facility and those who work at a BioLife center or BioLife lab may be subject to different guidelines. If you are contacted by a Takeda recruiter about your job application we encourage you to seek more information on the applicable guidelines for the Business Unit/Function to which you have applied. In accordance with the CO Equal Pay Act Colorado Applicants Are Not Permitted to Apply. #LI-SGM EEO Statement Takeda is proud in its commitment to creating a diverse workforce and providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race color religion sex sexual orientation gender identity gender expression parental status national origin age disability citizenship status genetic information or characteristics marital status status as a Vietnam era veteran special disabled veteran or other protected veteran in accordance with applicable federal state and local laws and any other characteristic protected by law.Be a thought leader in helping to further drive the three pillars of the Center of Expertise (COE): Education Evaluate and Execute. Work collaboratively with internal stakeholders and external partners to drive prioritization of opportunities across the R&D (portfolio and asset level) and lead analytical capabilities for business impact. Drive the skill development initiatives across broader R&D organization to align with capabilities in analytics and technology. Develop and implement the Strategy to drive informed decision-making and the right outcomes. Set direction and leads the evaluation of technology platforms and external vendors aligned with the Shinrai Center for AI/ML mission and vision as well as key areas of focus. Engage internal and external SMEs (e.g. digital KOLs patients academia) to refine approach to solving unmet needs and to design/identify optimal solutions. Partner with R&D leadership and learning to identify platforms and opportunities for scalable experiential digital learning (to build comfort with digital concepts and approach). Develop and maintain best practices for analytics methods in partnership with the Business Unit Data & Analytics Delivery Teams. "Expand the organizations research and analytics offerings especially in emerging analytical approaches skills and technologies focusing them on digital delivery innovation." Manage a team of machine learning scientists foster collaboration encourage their career growth and invest in skills development. Oversee the development and integration of tools applications and statistical workflows that enable interactive hypothesis-driven data analysis by scientists with diverse levels of computational and bioinformatic expertise in a dynamic research environment. PhD (or equivalent) with approximately 12 years experience or MS with approximately 15 years experience (computer science data sciences or a related field). Conversant in the pharma/biotech R&D from target discovery through clinical development Digital literacy and proven ability to drive change using novel technologies. Digital literacy and proven ability to drive change using novel technologies. Understanding of programming principles tech development and data management process. Cultural agility and experience working within a diverse and complex organizations. Team player with the ability to drive cross-disciplinary collaborations while demonstrating humility and resiliency. Experience using design thinking to problem solve (from critical needs identification to solution deployment/execution). Well-organized self-directed and customer-centric. Effective and persuasive communicator with executive presence and ability to build followership. Eternal curiosity and desire to learn. Strong external network in innovative digital technologies (e.g. innovators in academia and startups). Proven experience in failure and continuous learning mindset. Experience leading teams that have developed and deployed AI/ML models with material impact preferably in the enterprise software domain. Strong command of statistics and the science underpinning machine learning techniques and able to defend choices with math as well as real-world tradeoffs. Deep professional and technical expertise in platforms and tools development data science and/or advanced analytics preferably with exposure to the biopharma industry. Comprehensive Healthcare: Medical Dental and Vision Financial Planning & Stability: 401(k) with company match and Annual Retirement Contribution Plan Health & Wellness programs including onsite flu shots and health screenings Generous time off for vacation and the option to purchase additional vacation days Community Outreach Programs and company match of charitable contributions Family Planning Support Flexible Work Paths Tuition reimbursement

title: data analyst
desc:
"Applecart is a high growth marketing technology company based in New York City founded in 2013. Applecart has developed a proprietary social graph platform that uses publicly available data to map over 25 billion social relationships between more than 250 million adult Americans. Applecarts platform helps major corporations national nonprofit organizations and high-profile political campaigns with their highest stakes marketing challenge: reaching hard-to-reach audiences of decision makers spanning corporate executives legislators regulators investors members of the media and more.
For years marketing technology businesses have focused on solving b2c (consumer) marketing challenges (e.g. look-a-like modeling to find new customers) but the traditional pay-per-impression advertising model has left a massive opportunity unsolved for: how to market when a companys target isnt the average consumer but is instead a single senior decision maker. Applecart is the solution to this problem for some of the worlds most prominent organizations.
Quick facts about us:" "About the Role
We are looking for creative self-motivated flexible thinkers to join our team as a Data Analyst. Working with Applecarts political strategists data analysts and data scientists the Data Analyst will contribute to targeting analytics and polling efforts on behalf of some of the countrys most prominent trade associations political campaigns non-profits independent expenditure efforts and corporations." "What Youll Do" Who You Are
Qualifications: Preferred Qualifications: Job Type: Full-timeApplecart has generated over $40M in revenue and is growing 100%+ Y-o-Y "Our senior leadership team includes two members of the 2021 Forbes 30 under 30 list for Marketing and Advertising a former senior White House advisor one of the earliest sales leaders at Google and Twitter and two of the Democratic Partys most successful pollsters and strategists" Our investors include global sports entertainment and marketing giant Endeavor KKR Co-Chairman and Co-CEO Henry Kravis entrepreneur Chris Burch a founder of Palantir senior engineering leaders at Twitter and Yelp past CEOs of Fortune 50 companies and a number of well-known venture capitalists. Endeavor CEO Ari Emanuel is a board member of the company. Our work has been featured on Morning Joe on MSNBC Bloomberg and The Colbert Report and in Axios BusinessWeek the Associated Press Forbes the Washington Post and Politico among many others. Work quickly and fluently in SQL to assess ingest and transform raw datasets into digestible analytics reports "Partner with other data analysts to build predictive models using Applecarts social graph demographic and political behavior datasets" Translate findings from data analysis into digestible reports for non-technical client audiences Build advertising audiences for targeting and marketing that will drive maximum ROI with limited client resources Draft survey questionnaires create targets for weighting create top-lines and QC the result. College level coursework in statistics survey research data analysis sampling or mathematics Ability to manage multiple tight timelines with competing deadlines Outstanding attention to detail you find the things others miss Interest in or passion for politics the legislative process technology data analytics and data science Ability to produce intuitive client-ready data reports and visualizations Proficiency in SQL Experience working in advocacy public affairs political campaigns public policy product marketing market research or marketing analytics History of being a self-starter and proactive team member Experience with Python Experience with survey research and experimental design techniques (A/B testing RCT etc. )

This position requires technical skills and the ability to understand document configure administer troubleshoot and resolve issues in Linux environments. This is a customer-facing position. desc: Looking for a career in which you can make an impact? Join the award-winning IQVIA eCOA team on its journey to disrupt the healthcare industry and improve patients’ clinical research experience. Who we’re looking for: You will be part of a small and growing team of developers located across the US focused on building new and modern software that’s positioned to revolution the clinical trial space. In this remote role you’ll be empowered and encouraged to think “outside the box” to develop innovative solutions to drive business and the industry forward. Not only do you love to code you are a self-motivated individual who can apply strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills to daily challenges. You’re ultimately a JavaScript/TypeScript aficionado but also enjoys wearing many different hats. Position overview: We’re seeing immense growth in the industry and so our core focus is scaling our application with stable distributed back-end services. Bring your talent and drive to our team of passionate creative and innovative thinkers focused on developing a sophisticated product that uses modern JavaScript. We have the support and resources of a large company but operate with a start-up culture. You’ll thrive in a fast-paced and agile environment during which you see real-time results. RESPONSIBILITIES: SKILLS: IQVIA eCOA "Patients will always be the ultimate customer in healthcare but they need to be heard. Our goal is to help ensure that each patient is at the center of care and give them a voice to share their story. IQVIA’s eCOA (electronic clinical outcomes assessment) Division has developed an award-winning platform that intelligently automates capturing patients experiences through real-time direct-from-patient data collection. This enables the client real-time access to the patient’s experience which in-turn improves the treatment and eventual outcome." At IQVIA we believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. The advanced analytics technology solutions and contract research services we provide to the life sciences industry are made possible by our 70000+ employees around the world who apply their insight curiosity and intellectual courage every step of the way. Learn more at jobs.iqvia.com. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race color religion sex sexual orientation gender identity national origin disability status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law. IQVIA Inc. provides reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities. Applicants who require reasonable accommodation to submit an application for employment or otherwise participate in the application process should contact IQVIA’s Talent Acquisition team at workday_recruiting@iqvia.com to arrange for such an accommodation.Work collaboratively and efficiently across functional teams in a fast-paced startup-like environment. High standard of engineering quality through code reviews and unit tests. Extend our platform to handle an expanding set of features. Design extend and implement APIs. Create engineering efficiencies through automation and development of tools. Regularly make specific determinations about system performance and respond with sense of urgency to review and fix bug reports. Define engineering processes for product launch and releases. Proactively work with Quality Assurance and DevOps to solve system problems. Review and refactor legacy code. Provide technical guidance and coaching to peers. Expert in JavaScript/TypeScript Node and Express.js Experience in working with Postgres DynamoDB (Apache Pulsar Kafka ScyllaDB a plus) Experience with cloud-based infrastructure (AWS Google Cloud Azure) Familiar with system monitoring services (DataDog Sentry.io CloudWatch) Ability to work independently and remotely with minimal supervision Strong attention to detail

Consultant/Analyst/Healthcare Planner II & III The Innova Group is searching for a qualified Consultant/ Analyst/Healthcare Planner II & III to join our multidisciplinary planning team and support all aspects of project research analysis and deliverable development. The selected candidate for this position will analyze assist and develop innovative planning solutions for strategic operational and/or facility planning issues for a multitude of service lines with healthcare system clients. The most successful candidates will demonstrate skills and experience in a blend of data science analytics data management and healthcare planning. The Innova Group is a Healthcare Planning Consultancy with offices and staff in Austin Atlanta Boston Dallas Denver Minneapolis Portland St. Louis Tucson and Washington DC. Since 1995 we have been developing innovative solutions in healthcare strategy operations and facility planning both nationally and overseas. We offer a small entrepreneurial team culture with direct leadership mentoring training and involvement. We work primarily on the “pre-design” portion of a capital investment project to build healthcare facilities —working with clients to ensure the project meets strategic financial and operational goals— setting the table for architectural design and real estate acquisition process. The Innova Group is a source of strategic healthcare planning and consulting services for large private systems such as Kaiser Permanente and Dignity Health academic medical centers such as the University of New Mexico community hospitals and public sector systems such as the Military Health Service Indian Health Service and Veterans Affairs. More information on our firm is available at www.theinnovagroup.com. Salary Range: Level II: $65000-100000 Level III: $100000-150000 dependent upon experience and qualifications Job Description Qualifications Required Statistics Economics Applied Mathematics Architecture GIS or other data/analysis intensive major Technical Skills Considered Location/Benefits/Travel These positions are being offered nation-wide with preferences for communities with an existing Innova presence and Tucson. Depending on experience the Healthcare Planner II positions may require an in- office position in Austin Dallas Denver Minneapolis St. Louis or Tucson. We offer paid vacation healthcare healthcare savings account 401K and profit-sharing benefits. Compensation will be commensurate with qualifications and experience. Six to ten days travel per month may be required of this position. Application Requirements Interested individuals should submit an electronic (word or pdf) copy of their resume with a cover letter. A cover letter is essential and should clearly identify your career goal your rationale for applying a summary of your education and past work experience and why you are a good fit for the position. Submissions without a cover letter will not be accepted. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race color religion sex sexual orientation gender identity or national origin. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $65000.00 - $150000.00 per year Benefits: Schedule: Ability to commute/relocate: Application Question(s): Education: Experience: Willingness to travel: Work Location: Multiple LocationsAcquire normalize and analyze multi-sector medical data (patient/facility/physician) utilized in modeling healthcare delivery and developing operational alternatives for healthcare systems Forecast future healthcare utilization through trend analysis and extrapolation Present and display data analysis and findings to help clients make decisions Demonstrate expertise utilizing healthcare strategy planning metrics and emerging trends to define operational processes and resource requirements (capital space and staff) in healthcare planning documents for clinical staff administrators and architects Assist and conduct strategy operations and facility evaluations Assist and conduct Facility Master Plans and Regional Health Care System planning Lead facilitate guide and oversee analysis and planning on multiple project types and client sectors Bachelor’s and/or master’s degree in one of the following programs: Healthcare Business Level II: 4 -10 years of experience in healthcare strategy operations and/or facility planning Level III: 10-15 years of experience in healthcare strategy operations and/or facility planning Broad knowledge of healthcare services delivery models data sets related codes and facility finance and/or operation related planning metrics Ability to create and communicate relevant solutions to complex problems through thoughtful and analysis Public Speaking Demonstrated team player with mentoring and/or leadership skills MS Office: Outlook Word PowerPoint and Excel (intermediate proficiency required - Pivot tables complex “if” statements conditional formatting) SQL: intermediate proficiency (import data indices query/table development CTE creation etc.). Database and/or application development skills GIS Experience Graphics capability (Graphic Design/Media/Other Dimensions) Business Intelligence Tools o Tableau o Power Bi Experience related to Innova core sectors (healthcare strategy/operations/facility planning) Familiarity with CAD standards/procedures as well as Revit are desirable but not required. When attaching your resume please use following filename style: " last name_first name_resume.doc/pdf" (for example if your name was Chris Miller and you were submitting a pdf file your resume would be saved as "miller_chris_resume.pdf". Your cover letter may be copy/pasted directly into the box provided in the Indeed.com submission process. The Innova Group does not compensate candidates for travel expenses associated with interviewing unless otherwise indicated at the time of call for interview. 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Monday to Friday Austin TX: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Are you comfortable with public speaking? Do you presently hold a leadership or mentoring position within your current organization? How many years of healthcare operations experience do you have? How many years of healthcare strategy experience do you have? How many years of facility planning experience do you have? Are you willing to relocate to Tucson Austin or Dallas where The Innova Group has a presence? "Bachelors (Required)" Healthcare management: 4 years (Required) 50% (Preferred)

desc: Become a Part of the NIKE Inc. Team NIKE Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow think dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers leaders and visionaries. At NIKE Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game. We are looking for a Sr. Director Consumer Insights and Analytics. This role will lead “the voice of the Jordan consumer” and provide meaningful data-based insights. We need this individual to bring a strategic perspective on the consumer and their relationship to basketball culture. We need a strong influential leader with deep expertise in driving insights analytics and strategy! This role will be a critical part of the leadership team of Global Jordan Consumer Science + Insights team and the lead for North America Jordan Brand Insights and Analytics. Through partnership with the other marketplace units with strong functional expertise this team powers the geography’s consumer strategy applying quantitative and qualitative methods at the pace of the consumer. The Sr. Director will partner across other multi-disciplinary analytics teams at Nike and Jordan building and owning relationships with diverse business partners. You will also partner with Gender Leaders within Jordan North America to prioritize opportunities and build a pipeline of insights and data that helps inform every aspect of our value chain. NIKE Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package casual work environment a diverse and inclusive culture and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location or the role every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world. NIKE Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race color religion sex national origin age sexual orientation gender identity gender expression veteran status or disability.Synthesize quantitative and qualitative data to drive macro business strategies that will enable North America to reach its revenue goals through the gender offense leading with a deep understanding of Jordan consumers and Nike Direct members Be the advocate for the Jordan Brand consumer in North America ensuring we are meeting their needs in an evolving marketplace by influencing analytics work done across the analytics functions: Nike Direct Commercial and Reporting Evangelize fact-based decision making at the Jordan Brand leadership table – partnering with North America Jordan Team Gender functional leaders (Nike) and their teams to improve data literacy and elevate the role of insights to inform long term strategies and seasonal planning/execution Influence the Global Jordan Brand agenda on behalf of the geography by elevating data infused priorities that will be surfaced to the global gender table through the Jordan Brand North America GM in partnership with Global Consumer Market Research Find opportunities to drive growth aligned with North America strategic priorities "Bachelors degree or higher or equivalent combination of education and experience and training" 10+ years in Data Science Advanced Analytics and/or Consumer Insights Applied experience interpreting qualitative and quantitative data to drive business decisions that will enable membership and revenue growth across the integrated marketplace in North America. 5 or more years of demonstrated ability influencing a multidisciplinary team and a proven history of analytical team leadership communications and building business partner relationships Validated achievements in solving real-world advanced analytics challenges and leading a sophisticated portfolio and multiple partners in a fast paced dynamic and matrixed team and business environment Experience building and implementing strategic business processes within a large organization including working with technology partners to deliver information solutions Excellent written presentation and verbal communication up to the senior executive level and out to wide diverse audiences Ability to successfully navigate a highly matrixed organization and work closely with teams across segments of the company Familiarity with very large data sources and best-in-class research methods and applied statistics including sampling approaches causal modeling time series analysis and data-mining techniques in collecting and predicting consumer sentiment behavior and feedback

desc: Maintains a personal relationship with Jesus Christ. Is a consistent witness for Jesus Christ maintains a courteous Christ-like attitude in dealing with people within and outside of Compassion and faithfully upholds Compassion’s ministry in prayer. Acts as an advocate to raise the awareness of the needs of children. Understands Christ’s mandate to protect children. Commits to and prioritizes child protection considerations in all decision-making tasks and activities across the ministry. Abides by all behavioral expectations in Compassion’s Statement of Commitment to Child Protection and Code of Conduct. Reports any concerns of abuse neglect or exploitation of children through Compassion’s internal reporting process and appropriately supports responses to incidents if they occur. Develops and communicates actionable recommendations to a variety of audiences. Creatively explores ways to communicate data across many unique cultural contexts to ensure the recommendations are well understood. Works with senior management to formulate major analysis plans and designing or developing complex questionnaires tests research plans and other guides to ensure the necessary data is captured to perform an actionable analysis and recommendation. Mines research data from available internal sources industry reports public information field reports or purchased sources with revenue generation of effectiveness strategy and business result implications. Further tests are conducted or coordinated to ensure that data is valid and consistent with defined needs. Conducts in-depth data review using traditional and advanced methods including extremely complex statistical techniques and performs complex analyses and prepares forecasts and recommendations in the areas of program efficacy enriched revenue generation market penetration market practices competitive strategies and program enhancements. Based on predictive analytics authors major reports profiling and predicting outcomes related to marketing program financial or economic issues for review by executives managers and other stakeholders involving making live presentations answering questions and instilling confidence in stakeholders. Maintains or cooperates in the maintenance of business intelligence tools databases dashboards systems or methods including the creation or review of technical design documentation to ensure the accurate development of reporting solutions. Provides technical support for existing reports dashboards or other tools or systems including design of related databases spreadsheets or outputs as well as maintain a library of model documents templates or other reusable knowledge assets. Coaches and provides expertise and may oversee the work of other professionals and support staff in the business intelligence and analysis discipline. "Bachelors degree in Statistics Mathematics Economics Computer Science Quantitative Analysis Monitoring & Evaluation Impact Evaluation Engineering or equivalent technical field**" Three years of experience in business analytics business intelligence data warehousing quantitative analysis and/or data science Three years of experience demonstrating leadership ability to lead people and achieve results through others while staying organize in managing multiple projects simultaneously Strong oral and written communication with the ability to explain complicated or technical information in a simple way to non-technical audiences Strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills including the ability to apply quantitative analysis techniques to real-world business problems Advanced Knowledge in SQL relational databases preferred Proficiency with Python or similar programming language to clean manipulate and present data Proficiency with data visualization tools like Tableau to create insightful impactful and interactive dashboards Experience with Cloud based services a plus - Google Cloud AWS Azure services used for Data storage and Data ingestion/ transformation like S3 ADF Glue etc. Knowledge of ETL and data warehouse concepts/processes Knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms (k-NN SVM DT etc.) Experience using statistical analysis/programming tools such as SAS SPSS or R preferred. The mission: Join a team that is motivated to release children from poverty in Jesus’ name. Our benefits: Receive generous paid time off 10% contribution to a 403(b) retirement fund excellent health-care coverage and\nmore\n. Spiritual growth: Participate in regular chapel services prayer groups and department devotionals.

title: data engineer
desc: Overview Right now CPGs and retailers are working in the dark when it comes to pricing information and strategy. Datasembly is changing that. These are massive industries with billions of dollars on the line every year. Datasembly’s data-driven approach is changing how these companies are thinking about pricing strategy deploying billions of dollars and communicating both internally and externally. And we are just getting started. Why Datasembly? What makes a Sembler? What We Need From You The Details Datasembly is a fully-remote organization. We provide a convenient WFH work-life-balance health dental and vision benefits allowances for home office gear and co-working spaces as well as unlimited PTO and generous parental leave. Datasembly is only hiring those authorized to work in the United States and unable to provide visa sponsorship at this time. Salary Range: 110k-140k The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range of candidates hired. Factors that may be used to determine your actual salary may include your specific skills location how many years of experience you have and comparison to other employees already in this role. Most candidates will start in the bottom half of the range. "Were an Equal Opportunity Employer: You will receive consideration for employment without regard to race sex color religion sexual orientation gender identity national origin protected veteran status or on the basis of disability." Job Type: Full-time Pay: $110000.00 - $140000.00 per year Benefits: Schedule: Application Question(s): Work Location: Remote"Datasemblys product is easy to understand explain and provides a huge impact for our customers- your work will be clear and meaningful" Work from home with flexibility to be successful and complete your work in the way that works best for you Experience a growing highly innovative and collaborative startup environment Company retreats to interesting locations 3 times a year Excellent colleagues unlimited PTO and generous paid parental leave among other perks An egoless team first attitude A love for documenting and disseminating knowledge "Passion for technology- youll be teamed up with devs who geek-out over data" Enthusiasm to wear many hats take ownership and initiative The Data Engineer will join a small Data Science team. The primary responsibility is to work alongside Data Scientists to add rigor and scalability to each phase of data projects -- feature engineering predictive modeling speed anomaly detection and more. The team is in its first year which means most projects are greenfield -- ideal for a creative thinker that desires to make a big impact. 2+ years of development experience preferably on projects that touch machine learning systems. Strong familiarity with the modern python data science ecosystem. (pandas numpy scikit-learn torch). Experience working with a cloud-based data warehouse such as Snowflake Hive Redshift. Familiarity with scheduling tools such as Airflow Luigi. Experience working with cloud infrastructure such as AWS or GCP. Working knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes. Experience working with larger than memory datasets using a distributed data processing framework. Ability to learn new techniques on the job to solve business problems. Experience with Scala a plus Experience working with NLP/image processing a plus. 401(k) Dental insurance Employee assistance program Flexible schedule Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Parental leave Vision insurance Monday to Friday Will you now or in the future require sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g. H-1B visa status)?

title: data engineer
desc: "Are you a high performing technologist passionate about cutting edge data engineering developments? Do you enjoy reading and investigating advancements in applied data engineering? Are you the go-to mentor and teacher in your organization and community for others who want to learn more about data engineering? As a member of Capital One’s data engineering community in our Tech College organization youll be part of an elite group that’s spreading knowledge and understanding about data engineering to experienced data engineering practitioners newcomers to the art and executives who need to make decisions regarding data engineering utilization and projects." Learning is now a continuous lifelong activity. Since tech skills now have a half-life of about two and half years how could it be any other way? Recognizing this Capital one established Tech College in 2017 to revolutionize the learning experience for associates. In particular Tech College is technologist-driven. Yes we do have experts in learning and educational design. But it’s the subject matter experts in machine learning data engineering cloud cyber mobile software engineering and agile that set the direction and curate or create the learning content. As a Data Engineer in the Data Discipline of Capital One’s Tech College you’ll be part of a team responsible for curating designing developing and delivering highly engaging learning experiences that will fuel our growth as a tech company and help our associates develop cutting-edge skills in data engineering. We’ll also expect you to keep up with the latest and greatest data engineering tools and capabilities so that you can lead Capital One’s data engineering community. You will work alongside highly technical peers with deep domain expertise to deliver game changing learning experiences for our associates. You’ll also be expected to work with our university partners in getting creative about data learning. Tech College is a great spot from which to learn about Capital One’s broader data engineering community so you can spot your next great opportunity for whenever you’re ready to move back into full-time project delivery. Tech College is a bold investment in developing our associates and leaders recruiting top technical talent and continuing to differentiate ourselves in the market. Tech College aims to transform our approach to enabling our associates and leaders with the technical skills they need to be successful in current and future roles. Who you are: Experienced. You need to have earned a few bumps and bruises while developing and implementing data engineering solutions to business problems. Innovative. You continually research and evaluate emerging technologies. You stay current on published state-of-the-art methods technologies and applications and seek out opportunities to apply them. A leader. You challenge conventional thinking and work with stakeholders to identify and improve the status quo. You’re passionate about talent development. Technical. You’re comfortable with open-source languages and are passionate about developing further. You have hands-on experience developing data science solutions using open-source tools and cloud computing platforms. In this role you will: Partner with a cross-functional team of data scientists software engineers product managers and learning specialists to develop and deliver a learning product that people love Teach a broad stack of technologies — Python Tensorflow Scikit-Learn AWS H2O Spark and more — for revealing the insights hidden within huge volumes of numeric and textual data Teach others how to build data engineering models through all phases of development from design through training evaluation validation and implementation Flex your interpersonal skills to translate the complexity of your work into tangible business goals Curate existing content from various sources like universities commercial content providers and publicly available material Develop and conduct training through a variety of modes (in person on-line self-paced blended) Create hands-on challenges to highlight Capital One data business problems and practices Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree At least 2 years of experience in data engineering At least 2 year of experience working on streaming data applications (Spark Streaming Kafka Kinesis or Flink) At least 2 years of experience with Python or Scala Preferred Qualifications: Master’s Degree 1+ years of experience with a public cloud (AWS Microsoft Azure or Google Cloud) 3+ years of experience in Python Scala or R 3+ years of experience in machine learning 1+ year of experience in teaching or creating curriculum content At this time Capital One will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position and you require an accommodation please contact Capital One Recruiting at 1-800-304-9102 or via email at RecruitingAccommodation@capitalone.com. All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations. desc: About Us: Versova a family of companies is a leader in the production of eggs and egg products with operations in Iowa Ohio Washington and Oregon. Our fully integrated operations raise chicks young hens and laying hens. To ensure our eggs are fresh safe and wholesome when they reach our customers we produce and process more than 3 billion eggs annually right on our farms. Our farms are committed to the passionate adherence to animal care standards for our flocks. We believe in responsibly operating our farms to help protect the environment being good neighbors in our communities and producing the safest highest-quality eggs for our consumers. We offer competitive wages a compensation program with excellent benefits including 401K health dental Short-Term Disability and life insurance. Job Summary: The Nutrition Specialist is a cross-functional role with responsibilities in formulation and ingredient procurement. This includes maintaining all information in the least-cost formulation software and working with ingredient vendors to ensure that company feed mills have a reliable supply of ingredients.\nEssential Job Functions:\nThis list of duties and responsibilities is not all-inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties and responsibilities as management may deem necessary Qualifications and Skills: Education and Experience: Travel: This is primarily an office job. The employee will be asked to periodically visit company feed mills and attend industry tradeshows requiring overnight travel. Mills are in Ohio (2) Iowa (3) Washington (1) and Oregon (1). Location: Preferred Ames Iowa or company office in Sioux Center Iowa; Johnstown Ohio; or Canby Oregon. Remote work arrangements considered. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. (While performing the duties of this job the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger handle or feel; and talk or hear. "Versova" is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race gender national origin color religion age genetics sexual orientation disability or veteran status. NOTE: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. The employee may perform other related duties as assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities duties and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time as needed. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $45000.00 - $71000.00 per year Benefits: Schedule: Work Location: One locationManage formulation software for multiple feed mills including maintaining ingredient prices nutrient levels and diet specifications. Run least-cost optimization and transmit formulas to feed mills accurately and timely. Summarize and interpret laboratory results of ingredients and complete feed. Work in multiple software systems as an integral part of feed ingredient tracking and accounting. Continually seek improvements in processes develop efficiencies and expand the use of existing and new software. Collaboration with feed milling team ingredient purchasing and accounting as an integral part of our egg production team. Occasional requests outside normal working hours to support feed milling operations. Other duties as needed. Detail oriented and analytical. Ability to take large amounts of data and summarize into actionable information. Proficient with MS Excel including writing and troubleshooting basic macros. Ability to manage complex situations through critical thinking problem solving and decision-making skills. Ability to adapt effectively and work at a high level within a fast paced continually changing and demanding environment. Ability to communicate effectively with all constituencies including employees customers suppliers and regulatory agencies. Ability to work independently manage time effectively and prioritize multiple requests. Feed formulation or data science experience preferred Relevant areas of study – Animal Science Ag Business Accounting Mathematics or related. Experience in the feed ingredient poultry agriculture or food processing industry a plus 401(k) Dental insurance Flexible schedule Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Vision insurance 8 hour shift
